Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location, easy to find, easy parking, breakfast was good but limited selection for a full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service needs some brushing up”
Reviews.Author: anjo85 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think the overall hotel is very good in terms of value for money and location; but customer service is a bit lacking. The reception staff didn't know much of the Accor products ie. Le Club tiers. But it seemed like an insult to Accor themselves, when the reception staff informed me that he's never dealt with Platnium Le Club Member before and just left it at that. I had to almost beg for a late check out of 1pm, especially since the hotel wasn't overtly busy that weekend. I'll be staying at this hotel again next Tuesday, and wonder if my experience would be any different.

Reviews.Title: “Incidentals that should be free might add up to more than the room cost!”
Reviews.Author: mandyintransit
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for holiday or business stays, it's clean and close to Darling Harbour. But, there are basic things offered free in hotels internationally that are charged at the Novotel Rockford - for example, Internet access is $15 for 30 minutes or $30 for 24 hours. I've stayed in $30 a night hostels that have offered free wifi, is it wrong to expect it from $160 a night hotels?

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marc P
Reviews.Content: I had some go to Sydney for 2 nights on short notice and based on the reviews here and the affordable price, I decided to stay at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and stylish. It was excellent value and I'd definitely stay here again. The location was great, only 5-10 minutes walk into the CBD, and 5 minutes walk from Central Station which made it easy to get to and from the airport. The staff were very efficient and helpful. They looked after my luggage after check out as I had some meetings left in the city, and allowed me to use their change rooms when I came back to pick up my luggage, even though I'd already checked out. They also gave me complementary access to their Club Lounge so I could print my boarding pass which was nice. Only two criticisms: - the service could have been friendlier, but that certainly didn't affect their effectiveness in looking after me. - internet access is $30 which was a bit steep, luckily I was able to tether off my iPhone instead.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location, but not up to usual Novotel standard”
Reviews.Author: Adrian182
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a convenient location, however, the room was average at best. Their "king beds" are two single beds zipped together. The bed itself was also uncomfortable. The toilet in my room did not flush properly, and the fittings in the room were very dated. The room was in need of renovation. The staff were friendly, and the room otherwise looked clean. I do not think I would stay there again - the room was not up to the usual Novotel standard.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: hellvelyn123
Reviews.Content: We stay here in February and spent an excellent three days in the city. We were allocated a room over looking the chinese garden which was excellent. The staff were helpful and very pleasant. The only slight negative was the breakfast. We paid an inclusive price but when I wanted an omlette I was told that it was extra and very expensive. I dont think they wanted the extra work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but unsatisfactory customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ymphz
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent as everything is accessible especially if you have kids with you. The room is clean but you could hear the noise outside. We stayed on a weekend and the police sirens are never-ending until wee hours in the morning. Maybe they could install better sound-proof walls especially on the lower floors. The customer service is unsatisfactory. I called housekeeping to complain about a defective appliance and i had to call back half an hour later because nobody bothered to come and check. Also, we were waiting for a friend at the lobby and witnessed a difficult customer arguing with the receptionist/manager(i think). the manager's voice was quite loud and both of them created a scene. maybe it would have been avoided if they argued inside a room because it created a bad impression on the frontliners as being unpleasant. No matter what the circumstances were, i truly believe receptionists should maintain grace under pressure with a welcoming smile. Any dificulties should be discussed on closed doors. I just have to stress that since I come from a customer service industry.

Reviews.Title: “a break away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was fantastic nice and relaxing easy walking to all events great food and shops, i would stay in darling harbour again and recommend friends

Reviews.Title: “reluctant return”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here previously and didnt enjoy the stay because of the traffic noise. On this accassion we were out in a room facing the entertainment centre and found it much quieter. The location is excellent and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall but bring your own pillow.”
Reviews.Author: courtneydcat
Reviews.Content: In a good location and quiet considering it's next to the entertainment centre. The staff are pretty good overall. The rooms are nice and what you would expect for a hotel of it's rating. The biggest negative us the extremely uncomfortable pillows. We booked a couple of rooms and all the pillows were bad in each room. We had more sent to but had the same problem. The 'valet' parking is also not worth the extra expense. We presumed this would be secure parking but our car was just parked in the street in front of the hotel overnight and we had to go collect it ourselves and load in the luggage ourselves. We may as well have self parked at the entertainment centre. Third negative was the really crappy 'executive club's which was unstaffed & had a broken coffee machine with insects flying out of it. There was a soft drink tap machine but no glasses to drink out of. Despite all this I would stay there again if I was attending an event at the Entertainment Centre or Darling Harbour. Just make sure you bring your own pillow if you want a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you are not fussy on necessities”
Reviews.Author: pbchurchy
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and the location was very good.. which just makes up for the old rooms in need of care and the price you have to pay. Very expensive for the quality of the rooms and the price of the service.. minimal conveniences and again for the price paid you would think some conditioner and body lotion for the bathroom would have been included. Breakfast is expensive and boring. I think for the rating the property holds? and the price you pay the balance of my experience would have to tip to poor.. the pumphouse restaurant and bar is one small facility in its favour.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary / Theatre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a of a few that was listed as available in the area to attend a musical theatre. Its location was good for what we needed and was easy to get to and return from the theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Leanne A
Reviews.Content: Mum and I stayed at Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour for 3 nights. We found the rooms comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet offered a wide range of hot and cold meal options. The adjoining pump house made the best hot potato wedges that I have ever eaten! :-) The location is perfect if you want to explore Sydney, Darling Harbour or have a conference at the Sydney Entertainment centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: LP7010
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location - close to Darling Harbour and China town and a short walk to the tram, monorail and Central Station. This is the only advantage - everything else is pretty mediocre. Our travel agent said this place was a four-star hotel but once we arrived, the standard did not live up to a four-star rating. Front desk service is unfriendly and surly, often bordering on rude. The room we stayed in was very dated, with old worn out chairs, scuffed paint on the walls and a very average bathroom (the flush handle was almost broken and we had to shove it back in to place to ensure that the cistern filled up after each flush). Cleanliness was somewhat below an acceptable level - we were there for 6 nights and it was pretty evident that they did not clean the bath tub at all during that entire time. Room service breakfast arrived on time, but was almost inedible. We did not bother trying the buffet breakfast, as it costs $30 and there are cheaper options available if you got to Darling Harbour, which itself is a fairly expensive area to eat! Most rooms do not have an in-room safe, so if you have valuables you will have to use the safe adjacent to the lobby. This seems a bit strange, as in-room safes are pretty common these days. All in all, an unsatisfactory hotel - I will not go back there and I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for business or easy access to a Darling Harbour event”
Reviews.Author: Malimover
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is really interesting and the views of the city itself pretty, but has some of the ugliest architecture in Sydney and the Novotel Rockford (not to be mistaken for the zigaret shaped Novotel Darling Harbour) is no exception. So I was delighted to go to my room and find I was looking right into the Chinese Tea Gardens. The location was perfect to get to the wharf area where all the eateries are, and walking distance of the local tourist attractions (eg the museums). The room was a good size for Sydney hotels, clean, pleasantly furnished with useful. The mattress could have been more comfortable - I found it to be a bit hard, but slept ok. There was some noise from the roads surrounding the Hotel - but no worse than any other similarly placed hotel and suprisingly little given its proximity to major roads. The service was good, but could have been quicker with a better check-in system. I didn't try the food as it was just as easy and far more fun and healthy to go for a walk and find dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever ever stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golferman2000
Reviews.Content: Cold showers Inedible food from room service No lobby to speak off, other than a couple of ratty old couches Smokers outside the main door continuously wafting into the lobby Hot Breakfast available at $30, even if you just wanted a poached egg, NO exception Two of the team staying got their rooms burgled, and the staff accused them of doing it. When I then spoke to the duty manager he was rude, accusing and said he didnâ€™t even believe it had happened. Room service very very slow â€“ including up to 50 rings for the phone to even be picked up Rude and surly staff in 90% of the cases. $30 dollars per day for internet, irrespective of the length of your stay. We booked as a party of 20, I do not think i have ever had such a bad experience in a hotel, the worst bit was they weren't the slightest bit interested in solving the problems.

Reviews.Title: “I wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rower_11
Reviews.Content: Having spent a busy day out and about decided to have room service. The phone rang out. I requested a rollaway, early in the morning returned early evening to find the bed still hadn't arrived, and the addition of some brown skid marks on the bathroom floor which looked suspiciously like faeces. How disgusting. Made a second request for the rollaway and complained about the marks on the bathroom floor, . The bed finally arrived, but we had to move the furniture ourselves to ensure that it fitted into the room. Housekeeping came to clean up the mess in the bathroom, equipped with a spray bottle and a rag. So much for hygiene. I was hugely disappointed the attitude of the front office staff which was basically "not my problem!". For such a huge chain the level of cleanliness or lack there of was astounding.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMJphotography
Reviews.Content: Very close to China Town and Paddy's Markets. A short walk to Darling Harbour and not too far from the nearest rail station. Comfortable room - good amenities. Parking reasonably cheap for central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockfords Haymarket is the one”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staying at Novotel Rockfords, Haymarket, and Sydney, Australia makes life easier, regardless of whatever reason you are travelling to Sydney. The location is excellent because it is right where excellent surroundings are filled with restaurants, shops, transport of all kinds and great people always on the move. The feeling is one of positive and moving forward and Novotel Rockford adds to it with its amenities, club and cafe as well as its restaurant-bar. I cannot recommend strong enough to anyone who looks for quietness, relaxing yet dynamic surrounding in one of the best sites of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Average property, reasonable location. Confusion about which Novotel”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMumCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for work in February. I asked for a quiet room and made it plain I didn't need a view - and that was supplied. I couldn't fault the reception or service once I made it to the hotel. HOWEVER, my taxi originally took me to the Novotel Darling Harbour which as it turns out is a different hotel. There I was told once I was finally served that I was at the wrong hotel and it would take me 15 mins to walk there. I was given a map and left to it. I was carrying bags and suitcases. Stupidly I did walk following the map. 30 mins later and exhausted from the heat and carrying everything I stumbled into the Novotel in Chinatown!!! It is NOT in Darling Harbour. Made me very cranky. Average rooms. Missing mini bar items. No iphone connectivity. Old rooms and bathrooms. Its OK but not worth any effort. The location is OK but do ask for a quiet room. Also no restaurant on-site but then it's right next to Chinatown. It is a walk to Darling Harbour - but that's OK if you're not carrying luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Avoid Breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: rosslou
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short stay at this hotel , overall must say i was quite impressed . Location is good , adjacent to the Entertainment Centre and Darling Harbour and easy walking to the city itself. We had a standard King room, room was a good size with a very comfy king bed, Good Size TV and good bathroom. Room and hotel itself was for the most part quite clean and tidy .Even though the hotel is situated right on a busy intersection it was very quiet - no traffic noise could be heard , only the odd siren penetrated the windows, which incidentally also provided us with quite a nice view ofd the cityscape and Chinese Gardens. Front desk staff were for the most part friendly though there was one( a manger no less) who was a bit surly for no apparent reason . The only cons were the garbage bins in the room were both broken , the foot pedals didnt work which meant you had to open the bin manually and get dirty hands each time - no biggy really but if you're going to have flip top bins make sure they work please . The gym and pool areas were great however every time we went there there was a shortage of pool towels , in the morning there was never any , if the gym/pool opens at 6.00 make sure there are towels ready please. Breakfast was a real disapointment - $30 or even $25 ( if pre booked) was way too expensive. The sausages and bacon were barely coooked , infact the sausages were raw , when I advised a staff member they shrugged and walked off ! Al ot of the plates were still filthy when put back into the severy for use , there was a shortage of cutlery , the juice glassess were dirty and sticky , apart from the hot chocolate there was very little to recommend about this breakfast. Overall I would definitely stay here again but would definitely look elsewhere for breakfast . Also parking is right next door at the Entertainment Centre - but make sure you get the desk to validate your ticket - you'll save yourself quite a few dollars !

Reviews.Title: “Great customer elations, average room”
Reviews.Author: Tones3044
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late on a Friday night. My plane was late, I was tired and the traffic around Mascot chaos. I booked in approximately 11.45 pm and as I had not dined, I asked the gentleman at the front desk about room service. He confirmed availability, but advised at this hour of night it was very limited. He was able to recommend a restaurant who would deliver and I was appreciative of the advice as the food was excellent. One downside was learning it would cost $35.00 to park my car. Despite being an Accor Advantage Plus Member i had no prior knowledge of this charge, but in view of the hour and the fact I was exhausted agreed to the charge. After arriving in my room I cursed the fact that I had left my phone in the car which by now had been taken to an offsite car park. Imagine my surprise when the duty manager knocked on my door to give me my phone which he had noticed in the car. The second disappointment was the room itself. It was very, very small and uninviting. I had stayed at this hotel before, but this was by far the worst room I had stayed in. I was very disappointed at this but again because of the hour, I was too tired to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Tucked away at Darling Harbour and close to the city too. This is the third time I've stayed at the Rockford Novotel and the service was as good as ever. A great room, friendly staff and the valet parking was a bonus too. I'd definite recommend the hotel to overseas guests :)

Reviews.Title: “Rockford darling harbour .. great for Chinese new year”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located close to darling harbour and China Town this was an ideal location for a brief stay for Chinese New Year celebrations in Sydney. The parade went past and the building was lit up with Chines dragons and flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Taketimeout
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Australia Day for 2 nights with wife and 3 boys under 10 y.o. Rooms were decent but not flash, slightly ageing but clean and tidy. For adjacent interconnecting rooms which was great. Excellent value for money ~$300/night for both rooms including buffet breakfast for all of us. Excellent location for enjoying Darling Harbour on Australia Day with young kids - could head back for regular rests, and no long trip home after 9pm fireworks. Indoor pool was great, but not huge - thankfully not many others used it :) We used it multiple times. All in all would definitely go again as a family, or on business but not as a couple (Four Points by Sheraton nicer for romantic getaway)

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard bed, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: KTJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Novotel have upped their visual standards in recent years - and the approach is consistent at least you know what you are getting!. When I arrived the systems were down and the room I had been allocated had been given to another person. This didn't really impress me as I had to wait until they found another room for me. The room I was then allocated was OK, but didn't have any kind of view and a walk in shower (suitable for a disabled person). There was no offer to change it to something more suitable. I have to complain about the beds. Rock hard. Same last time I stayed in one. The mattress thin, and on a solid rather than sprung base. Definitely chosen for style over comfort. I was a bit perturbed by the 1.5% charge for using my credit card on check out though. I think this is an unnecessary charge (and actually the room rate my company negotiates means I should not even pay this - but the chap on the desk would not listen!). The lifts were also a bit slow. Besides all that I would stay here again. The location is excellent and good value for money, I only hope the beds get fixed soon, and the checkout staff get training in negotiated rates clauses.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel tried to charge me $35 for valet parking when the car was never velet parked or parked at all. The car stayed out the front all night. I argued this point and then they reduced it to $25 (parking only)....i argued this point again and they did noty include parking..... i find the the staff arent friendly. I ws also at the reception area when a person walked of the street to get accomodation for 3 nighst and he was quoted by the manager on the front desk $127 per night includoing breakfast.... i paid $147 without breakfast..... This really leave a " sour " taste in my mouth and when my membership expires i will not be renewing it.... it seams i can get a better deal not been a memeber....

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value for what it is. Love the location. Cleanliness of room was sub-par but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that it was a one-off. The service was great, including the valet parking. Looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Membership not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For an Accor member, this was not woth the membership fee as I am not a frequent traveller and my service was no different than any other customer. The hotel was not the one I thought I booked, parking was too far from the hotel and it took an age to check in. I didn't get much help booking my complimentary night with membersip either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotal Rockford is a great location for taking in the sights of Darling Harbour and surrounds. Only drawback is the parking which is off site and expensive. The breakfast restaurant was suitable and pleasant and the room was well appointed. The Pumphouse restaurant was very good with a range of food and drinks. The pool was indoors and described as heated - not really very hot. Staff were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a real find! Perfect for 2 friends who each needed a single bed for the night. The twin room was compact but nonetheless perfect for an overnight stay and the bathroom was simple, clean and lovely, with its vibrant blue flecked tiles. Staff were really helpful (especially Jean Paul at the reception desk) and we were given a free delicious breakfast (have no idea why but it was a terrific addition). The swimming pool was quite deserted so my friend had it all to herself - wonderful. Above all, the hotel is around the corner from the marvellous Chinese Garden of Friendship and further along, the Temple of Love restaurant nestled at the top of the Darling Harbour promenade. Overall, an easy visit to Sydney and the Novotel Rockford is a great choice for staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location Rooms suitable for a short stay Excellant breakfast with well mannered staff. Easy parking and parking rates at nearby entertainment centre car park. Charge back from restaurant next door makes for easy stay . Overall a good hotel for a few nights

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pdn
Reviews.Content: Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour - who needs Taxis! Monorail station two minutes away, along with light rail to Pyrmont and Central Station, or five minutes WALK and your at the Darliing Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf dining precints, 5 mins the other direction to World Square Shopping. Not to mention Paddys markets and Entertainment Centre right next door. Dining in house was great at the Main restaurant come club/vibe- feel place after hours(cant recall name), Breakfast in cafe was good with fresh pastries and a Juicer Machine! Although staff service in here was missing at times! Hotel rooms good size and feel with views over Darling Harbour and Chinese gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but care with directions”
Reviews.Author: WestyTweedValley
Reviews.Content: My stay was comfortable, quiet and good value. The property was clean and very well-positioned near Chinatown and Darling Harbour. However the guest internet access was poor with out-of-order machines and guests taking too long with their use. There was also an inordinate wait at check out. The big warning is the address - do not just say Novotel Darling Harbour (there are two Novotels in the area) as they are a long way and an expensive cab ride apart. Make sure you give the full name to a driver and the address and that he/she takes you to the right one before they drive off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gin_Goh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel twice over the New Year period. All the rooms in Sydney during this period are expensive and thankfully, we managed to get a good deal on Wotif and Booking.com. The first room we got came with a double room which wasn't what we booked for but it was sorted out quickly after we called the reception. Our new room was on the 7th floor came with a King bed but there was dirt coming out of the air con vents. The left side of the bed was dotted with dirt particles. We called housekeeping but there was no answer so we went down to reception and requested for help. Someone was sent to the room immediately but all he did was to sweep away the dirt particles! He said it couldn't be coming from the air con vents as it's a central system and we're the only room with the problem. Well, it was definitely coming from the air con vents because we found the dirt particles when we returned to the room in the evening and again the next morning. But it wasn't a big issue so we just let it go. The second room we got was on the 2nd floor and it came with a HUGE flat screen TV. After spending the whole day at Bondi, it was wonderful to have a bathtub for us to relax in. We love the location as it's near to Chinatown, Darling Harbour, George Street and Star Casino. Food is literally at your doorstep. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel not so good”
Reviews.Author: dannie m
Reviews.Content: |My neice and I booked into this hotel for Christmas week and although location good I would not recommend this hotel. We moved rooms 3 times the first day (mold smell, then broken toilet, broken fridge). It is very mediocre for the price. The pool a lap (2 person) one that was usually full and seemingly didn't get cleaned for days on end (old towells, room service leftovers etc not removed); rooms small, no fresh air, staff inconsistent (nice and not so). The two interent terminals in lobby usually occupied by young children that parents seemd to have set them down at as babysitters. When manager asked to intervene in confrontation between guests he said 'not my problem' .. very weird customer service. I would NOT recommend this hotel .thankfully it was in a good location as we had other places to be during day/night as had no desire to spend anytime in room, lobby or restaurant. Oh and you could hear the people next door as if in same room !

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MACCheshireEngland
Reviews.Content: A bit late in writing this review as we stayed here in October, our journey started in the UK to Hong Kong and then this hotel for 4 night before moving on to Cairns. We arrived late at night and as we did not realise there were 2 Novotels in Darling Harbour our taxi took us to the wrong one (not his fault of course) so we then had to catch another taxi to this hotel. Had we known how close the 2 hotels were we could have walked, this hotel is a lot smaller than the Novotel which overlooks the Harbour, and I am guessing it is a lot cheaper. For us the location was very good, a short walk to the harbour, about 10 min walk to the train station, and a few minutes more into the city centre. Our room was small and quite basic, but it met our needs. We had paid for our room in advance, and had not booked breakfast as we thought $30 was rather expensive, as we ususally only eat toast, but as we checked in we were told breakfast was included, we did not argue, but took advantage of the toast each morning. Paddy's Market is a 5 minute walk away, and there is a McDonalds between the 2. This hotel is in the China Town district, and we did notice quite a few Asian Restaurants, one of which had a long line outside each night, we did not eat here as we had just come from Hong Kong. We did however have a really good meal at an Indian Restaurant in Darling Harbour, we think it was called "The Quay Indian" the food was really very good, and much cheaper than most other eateries around the harbour, we were very surprised to find it more than half empty, if you like Indian food, give it a try. We also took advantage of the free "walking tour" which is advertised in the tourist info shop, this took about 2.5 hours and was a leisurely walk around the city, you see places perhaps you would not find on your own, and the young lady who takes you around, passes on lots of facts. and as the title suggests it is free, though the young lady does live in hope of a tip. My tip is go on this tour it is well worth it. Even though we were only in Sydney for a few days we bought a travel pass for a week, we worked out that the places we wanted to visit would cost us more in travel than a pass, and we also visited a couple of extra places so we felt as if we were getting our money's worth, we just kept hopping on ferries and seeing where they took us, we left the passes in our hotel room with the tip, and hoped the room boy would take advantage of them. There are probably lots of similar hotels in the area, but all I am saying is that this one is fine, good location for getting around, basic but adequate, and if like us you are lucky you may even get a free breakfast, however if you have to pay for breakfast go to a restaurant, it is not worth $30

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to China Town and Darling Barbour. Parking is a big problem. Room is a little bit small. Other things are fine.Close to China Town and Darling Barbour. Parking is a big problem. Room is a little bit small. Other things are fine.Close to China Town and Darling Barbour. Parking is a big problem. Room is a little bit small. Other things are fine.Close to China Town and Darling Barbour. Parking is a big problem. Room is a little bit small. Other things are fine.

Reviews.Title: “City Shopping & Christmas Parties”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our stay. Just a short walk to Town Hall Station and trains to our friends and events on the Saturday night. Then a leisurely stroll to Darling Harbour for brunch with more friends. You could also head down to Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf so the choice is awesome. Also, went into the City to do stress-free Christmas shopping. Our room was clean and tidy, the bed very comfortable. The only thing to watch is the one way streets when you arrive if you are driving, but in saying that we headed north over the Harbour Bridge on our departure which is just a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR WORK STAY”
Reviews.Author: robyndouglas29
Reviews.Content: We were recently attending a conference at the Sydney convention centre and had the pleasure of staying at Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour. Great position, close to lots of restaurants and Darling Harbour with a very pleasant walk to get there. Comfortable bed, lovely view from room, complimentary chocolates very efficient and attentive staff, clean rooms. The pool was great for a quick refreshing dip and a few laps. Dinner at the restaurant was okay but definitely understaffed. Breakfast restaurant was lovely. I would definitely stay again and would recommend on my experience. Well done to Management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Dear review, We love the location, would have like a view of the garden, and maybe a room with a spa and lounge next time, and a longer stay , food is good , ok I am not one for long letter so i guess to be able to sent you a review on a shorter note would suit me , I love coming to darling harbour as it is beautiful i, love to just walk a dine by the sea , we love how the hotel is so close to everything ,we did the monorail this time as well to go and see the aqua show ,and after a long day coming back to a great bed and quiet kind regards Di

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastically located and just a wonderful part of Sydney. Hotel staff helpful and friendly! Definately stay again and definately recommend just on location alone. ......................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Harry S
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed overnight at the Novotel Rockford on a business trip. As an A|Club Platinum member, I called ahead to check whether we could be upgraded and were assured we would be. When we arrived late in the afternoon, we were not upgraded. We were both booked on a charge-back account, which was clearly indicated on our bookings and itineraries (our organisation is 10,000+ people and has a corporate account), but the hotel insisted that we provide our cards and would be billed for the room and any extras on departure. Only a 7am call the following to our travel unit solved the problem. In the rooms, the beds were bizarrely squeaky. I am normally a very deep sleeper, but the noise when I shifted was enough to wake me four or five times throughout the night. My colleague reported the same experience the following morning. The wood panelling in the room was broken or detached from the walls in many places. The blankets were made up too short for the beds. The bed-side alarm was missing the "On/Off" switch, so I had to use a cotton bud from the bathroom to avoid being woken at 4am. The in-room keyboard was missing its battery. There are plenty of other hotels in Darling Harbour. Go to them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Location the only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Fussiestcow
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay in Sydney to take my son to see the Sydney Kings play basketball at the Entertainment Centre and visit the Powerhouse Museum for the Harry Potter Exhibition. Location right next door to the Entertainment Centre and an easy walk to Powerhouse was the real bonus. We traveled into the city by train and caught the light rail to Paddy's Market and walked over to the hotel, very straightforward. However this hotel is showing its age and needs a revamp. Our twin room was very basic for the rate ($299). The linen was nothing special, the bathroom is a shower/bath and quite narrow, t.v. is not flat screen, small room with mini fridge. We had a room on the third floor which faced the Entertainment Centre and it was pretty quiet. Breakfast was quoted at $30 each for full breakfast or $15 for continental. We did not choose to have breakfast at the Hotel. We did however have drinks with friends across the road at the Holiday Inn. This hotel looked pretty fresh and I wish I had explored this option prior to my booking the Novotel. I am disappointed in this Novotel as we have used the brand all over Europe and Austrialia and this one just didn't have the polish and quality that we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Kiddy room again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Yet again although I had booked a King suite I was put in the kids twin bed room. The TV and phone didn't work, there was no iron and no bathroom products except one shampoo. Very poor - especially as I have been an Accor member since 2004 - you would think members might get better service and treatment than this.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford Darling Harour Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to Entertainment Centre for shows, Padddy's Market for bargains, Factory outlet shops, and beautiful Darling Harbour. Hotel has a great restaurant and cooperative & obliging staff in all areas. Room was comfortable with king size bed TV, desk, and shower over bath.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a very good position for the traveller”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be in a very convenient position for the holiday maker not requiring self comtained accommodation. Hotel is very close to excellent transport and restaurants. Great position for those who go to Chinatown and the Sydney Entertainment Centre. Easy distance to the city cente etc. .

Reviews.Title: “The French do Novotel Better”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: I stopped using this hotel when I realised it was not value for money compared to the European versions.It's not that this is a bad hotel, it's just that it could do things better. Rooms are fine, beds could be better and some lack light. Bathrooms basic but clean and i would go along with previous comments regarding noise. Breakfasts are not great but have enjoyed some good meals in the pump house. Reception average - don't get caught up in the aircrew rush!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Looked at pump room for dinner but found it too noisy and cold. Had evening meal in room it was quite good but coffee table small to manage two dinners comfortably. Service at front desk very efficient and businesslike but not a lot of smiles due they were very busy. A little flustered at times. Good location, very clean hotel and certainly would come again. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were outstanding and very cheerful and a delight to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Worse bed we have ever spelt in one side was lower than the other by about three centimetres when reported to desk they just said sorry madam also the room was very noisy we could hear the lift opening and shutting.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and dreadful food!”
Reviews.Author: areyathere
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights recently and was given a noisy room overlooking the street. Breakfast food was ghastly as was room service. Definitely not a hotel for a business trip!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for our trip as we were close to Darling Harbour and transport. We were able to walk to a number of venues and close enough to use the public transport system (light rail, trains and ferries).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: nat_minero
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip.....the hotel is located at the darling harbor area near the Chinatown Aside from it is walking distance from the convention center and the Sydney opera house...there are lots of fantastic restaurants around. It's also walking distance from Paddy's, the perfect place to buy souvenirs .

Reviews.Title: “night out to nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff upon check in were fabulous it was prompt, to the point, without being hurried along. We got to the room the air conditioning didn't work and there was only 1 towel in the room. the TV was old and the carpet was lino. i used to work for Novotel Brighton Beach the hotel in over 20 years old and it had better quality then i found this. After a night out with my girlfriends we came back to the hotel where we proceeded to order room service, we were unable to order what we originally wanted , when we finally narrowed down what we could have the girls (who were not drinking) after eating the meal were sick for the rest of the night. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not everything”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights, It is well located at the southern edge of Darling Harbour, but the standard rooms is ridiculously small, don't have the King size beds they advertised, the room key decode almost every time you leave and they blame it on your having it with your credit cards. But even if you carry it alone, I invariably had to go to reception to get it coded again Had to remind them twice about servicing the room and the internet access is $30/24hours and patchy absent connectivity in "busy times" Got double charged for breakfast even after confirming it was "included in the room rate"

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Marley L
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute holiday booking so we were happy with the cost.. Great location close to everything, the staff were wonderful very happy to help with directions and things to go and look at. Over all very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel or overnight after concert”
Reviews.Author: ANZmanAvocaBeach
Reviews.Content: The Rockford is conveniently located in Haymarket across the road from The Entertainment Centre and minutes walk from the Darling Harbour Convention Centre. I've stayed here a few times and found the rooms surprisingly quiet for a city location, always clean and the service above average. If you are attending a conference at the Convention centre, this hotel is a good choice, very reasonably priced but offers all you need. Plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from and some good coffee. Also a good choice for a couple wanting a night in the city. If you are a jogger, you can walk out the door and jog for as far as you want without having to cross any roads.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Darhling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was an average size, reception desk staff very helpful and friendly, Breakfast staff not as attentive as other hotels, but open to feedback which was great. Hotel in a great location in China Town and close to Trade Centre and lovely Chinese Garden over the road. Easy taxi ride to city shopping precinct or easy 15 min walk. Thanks guys for pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and a good hotel. I've stayed here before and would again. For the location it is great value for money. The only reason I ranked sleep quality as good rather than very good this time is that for some reason the bed we had was really hard. This hasn't been the case previously so it may have been a one off. The buffett breakfast is average though and we prefer to eat out. There are some great places to eat around the corner past the Chinese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: brozlington
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this hotel gets away with calling itself a 4.5 star. Its far from luxurious.I'm puzzled where the good reviews come from. Maybe there are some better rooms that have been refurbished but ours was shabby and needed digging over.The walls were battered and scratched as was the furniture. We were given a supposed upgrade from a standard double to a superior king so the size of the room was ok,not too pokey.The decor however was dark navy and rather depressing rather than luxurious. Choice of toiletries was basic for 4.5 star. Tv never worked properly although reception staff came to it immediately on at least three occasions. Staff very nice no fault with them just the hotel itself.Would only give it 2 stars max.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I attended an event at the Entertainment Centre and this hotel is next door - an ideal location! At check in I had no issues and the staff were pleasant. The hotel is clean and neat. The rooms are small but again clean and offer all you need for a short stay. The hotel is also within walking distance to Darling Harbour restaurants or China Town. The Pumphouse is attached for a drink or food but you have to enter from outside or level 1 so while it is part of the hotel it does not feel as convenient as stopping at a lobby bar for drinks or coffee. Will stay here again. Love the location and it compensates for the tiny room and outside bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Ent Cent, avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beachski1007
Reviews.Content: We chose the Novotel Rockford for its proximity to the Entertainment Centre as we were going to a concert. On this front, it totally delivered because we walked out of the concert and were in our (previously checked in) room in minutes. Access to the hotel by car is difficult due to a tight turning in a little lane. We were held up on arrival because a maxi-taxi had got himself stuck â€“ he ended up scaping the side of the taxi to get out. Parking is in the Ent Cent car park so we paid an extra $10 (total $35) for valet â€“ totally worth it. We had a deluxe king room, which had a great view over the Chinese Gardens but was very small for â€œdeluxeâ€�. The bed was quite hard, but there were plenty of pillows and robes provided. In the morning, we had breakfast in the hotel. I usually donâ€™t do this because hotel breakfasts are complete rip-offs and this was in line with norms. We had a continental breakfast costing $24 each. I really only wanted some cereal and some hotels provide this a-la-carte for around $10, but this was not an option. The selection was average to below average. Nothing special. We also ordered barista coffee for an extra $3.50 each. This was a mistake. There is a coffee machine in the restaurant (like the ones in airport lounges), so I would have just gone with that had I noticed it before ordering (orders are placed at the entrance, not at the table). The coffees we ordered, however, took 30 minutes to arrive, and were no better than machine made ones. Overall, the Rockford is a fairly standard to slightly below average hotel, with the best feature being its proximity to the Entertainment Centre and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great site for a hotel with easy access to Darling harbour, Paddy's Markets, Chinatown and George Street. The Pumphouse Pub has some sensational beers and knowledgeable, helpful bar-staff. We had an upgrade from King to De Luxe and, frankly, I can't imagine how small the king and standard rooms must be, as the De Luxe upgrade wasn't exactly spacious. All the same, the staff, the ambience and the location - all excellent. Oh and the beers!!

Reviews.Title: “RELAX!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you would like a relaxing break from day to day life, then this hotel is situated in the hub of Darling Harbour. Walking distance to main Sydney shopping area, heaps of bars and restaurants and only a quick trip to The Rocks and other Sydney attractions. We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have been an ACCOR member for 5 years and the rooms I have been given were pretty average. In the current competitive environment I don't think I'll renew my membership as it does not confer any real benefit compared to other hotel deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great location: some small irritations.”
Reviews.Author: moeline
Reviews.Content: The little brother to the Novotel Darling Harbour, the Rockford is in a great location. Despite my best efforts, taxi drivers twice returned me to the wrong hotel, so I learnt to double check which hotel they were taking me to. Taxis queue outside the hotel from about 7am. I was there for Guy Fawkes, and enjoyed the night time crowds - I felt completely comfortable out and about by myself in the area at night. It's an eight minute walk to the convention centre, and just across the road to Chinatown. Bypass the first food hall and turn right, through Chinatown, to a fabulous Asian foodhall on the left which provides excellent takeaway/eat in from a variety of Asian cuisines. I had a standard king room, which was ... standard, and comfortable enough. The shower - over- bath leaked despite my best efforts to arrange the curtain. I did enjoy the view over the Chinese Gardens, which are well worth a visit. Housekeeping was OK: bins emptied daily, toiletries refreshed, but glasses not washed. Staff were generally helpful. The TV remote didn't work due to corroded batteries. (Quickly fixed.) I used the gym daily; it had a lovely outlook and the machines seemed well maintained. Peevishly I took a newspaper from reception each day, as none was provided at the room door. The free wifi in the lobby was interesting; when I told them that I preferred to use my own computer, they gave me a complementary (supposed to be $15) log in for 30 min each time, which also worked fine in my room. They did offer me a 24 hour log in (actual hours logged on only) for $30. I had the continental breakfast once, and as it was a lacklustre affair I couldn't really recommend it. (However I had a splendid and well priced breakfast at 'Plate', on the water front around to the right past the Convention Centre.) I'd be happy enough to return to this hotel; I really quite enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the location”
Reviews.Author: Bangi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a consequence of the Qantas distaster we had to cancel our reservation at the other Novotel at Darling harbor (I do not know if it is any different in style and facilities) and only got a room at this one when we finally made it to Sydney. The standard room with the king size bed is really standard and quite small - we had trouble placing the luggage for our 4 weeks trip that was coming to an end. Knowing the exaggerated charges of Accor for breakfast we had booked the rate without and went to Chinatown for a nice and cheap breakfast on the first morning - but on the morning of our departure we got a free cup of coffee at the coffeshop - thank you ! After 4 weeks of travel in Australia I would suggest that this hotel is still good value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: Couldn't rate this place any higher, the entire experience was fantastic, booked via wotif and had a free bottle of Champagne waiting in the room on arrival, the room itself was on the small side but looked brand new, big TV, iPod dock station and the bathroom was pristine. The staff were wonderful and always smiling, I couldn't fault it, the hotel, the staff and the location were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “national conference”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A pleasant stay. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. That is, the lady cleaning our room, the staff at breakfast, as well as reception staff. However, a significant problem for us was the lack of a useful computer at the hotel. The guests club lounge computer worked but the date on the computer was a week later than the date we were there. Consequently we could not make any appropriate bookings for flights or hire cars. And, the computers in the foyer did not work. Unacceptable, as computer communication is essential in this day and age!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Adam W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located for Darline Harbour (appx five minutes walk from the Convention Centre) and Chinatown, and if you can get a good price you should definitely consider staying there. Hotel staff were very helpful on check-in, check-out and the facilities were acceptable but be warned if you're a light sleeper or are bothered by noise then there's every chance you'll end up directly above an intersection as I did - leading to a night of hearing traffic. Also if you're travelling with kids or a TV fanatic beware of the television in the room which has a very outdated in-house system which, once you work out how to get it onto television instead of the in-house system, will only let you scroll one way through the channels which is highly frustrating if there's something you know you want to watch but have to go through 10 or 15 channels to get back to it. All in all an ok experience as long as you don't go in with expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Great nothing to fault”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay and have stayed here before and was happy the first time so booked to stay again. I I can't fault anything with this hotel. It is in a great location, the service is great, the food was great, the room was comfortable and clean room. My only negative comment would be that the rooms are a bit on the small size however at that price and, you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: webmonkeyuk
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Standard King" room around three weeks before our visit. The staff were helpful and friendly and made checkin/checkout easy. The rooms were a bit disappointing for a room of that price, I guess you're paying a lot for the location there. There was some mould on the air vents in our bathroom (622) which hadn't been cleaned (you could remove it with a cloth). The bedding was a little strange with a thin duvet sandwiched between two sheets. All in all a bit run down and slightly disappointed with our stay. Some other reviewers have mentioned noise being an issue, we were on the convention centre side and didn't find it noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Richo12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights early in October. The hotel is in a great position if you are interested in thed restaurants and night life of Chinatown. It is also very close to the monorail and Darling Harbour. I had a great view of the Chinese gardens from my room. The room was comfortable, though a bit smaller than some of the other hotels in that area. My only complaint was the breakfast. Whilst the food was OK, the service was very slow and people were continually waiting for plates. I would definitely stay there again as it is in a great position for me and my work. Value for money I thought was OK having stayed in a number of other hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay from 20th to 21 st Oct”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the service and hotel room. The bath tub could be a bit cleaner. Very nice smell all the way through the hotel and very quiet too which is fantastic. It was very easy to catch a cab. The staff was very friendly and always there to help.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Run Down and No Service”
Reviews.Author: Boyd L
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to come to this hotel for the price it was charging and see the old condition of the hotel and rooms. Doors with grafitti and carpet pulling up and fraying in hall ways. The rooms lacked cleaning, and rooms are small, pocky and not at all worth the dollars they are charging. I would stay at the Shangri La hotel nearby, much better value and amazing service and rooms at a comparable price. We tried to check out early at the Novotel and were met with unhelpful staff, who argue. This hotel lacked experienced staff and customer service. I will not stay at a Novotel or Accor property again after experiencing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would be happy to return to this motel. I was given an upgrade room only because I questioned the separtated Twin beds in the room when I had requested a king bed. Considering I had booked so early for 2 rooms, it would have been a nice gesture to upgrade at the time of the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: nanalois
Reviews.Content: Was unable to control A/C in room....stuffy for sleeping. Good location for China Town, markets. Not sure it deserves the 4 star rating it advertises. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Sydney. Loved the town.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Not far from Central station, from harbour and from downtown. The room on side to Darling Harbour is slightly noisy, I heard traffic from the street. Room was well furnished, there was good posibility to work with own computer. Only the internet acces is to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and the staff are excellent. The only downside was the poor quality cooked breakfast. For $30 the fare was mediocre.The tomatoes were boiled to an inch of their existence, the potatoes similarly and the poached eggs were hard rubbery things and not at all appetizing. My wife had the continental breakfast and for $24 we did not rate this as value either. The second and third breakfasts were taken away from the hotel. I completed an online survey initiated by the hotel, gave the same feedback as above, received a computer generated standard reply, but the hotel did not follow this up hence this very public response.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience never again”
Reviews.Author: AliceA62
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Novotel Rockford and upon arrival was told there was only one room in the system. The rooms were pokey and poorly cleaned and 2 days after our stay, the hotel decided to take an unauthorised financial transaction from my mastercard, despite the fact that I had already paid for both rooms when checking in. When I tried to call the hotel to rectify their error, I was met with rude, vague and uncooperative managers who could not explain their error and would not admit to it, let alone fix it. Another hotel manager named David also lied to me by writing that my bank already debited the money from the Novotel Hotel as reimbursement for the error; however this was not possible as my bank did not have the authorisation to perform such a transaction in such a short period of time and the complaint was lodged by myself less than 24 hours prior to his bogus email. I have still not received any reimbursement and as a result of this error my bank is still in arrears and the hotel has continually delayed reimbursing my account with bogus excuses. I will never stay there again and I warn other travellers to be wary of putting their credit card down as payment.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location walking distance to mono rail and light rail. Easy to get around . Traffic was a bit loud at night hard to sleep . Walking distance to markets,China Town,Darling Harbour, Chinese gardens lots to do.

Reviews.Title: “rockford darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival was not treated well, we have stayed there before but the girl at the front end was rude and just handed us the key and told us our room. We settled in our room to make a coffee and the coffee cup still had coffee in it. We went down to reception because we were suppose to have free internet the guy behind the counter explained how to use it and gave us a password. We stayed 2 nights it is a great venue for staying in the habour but it was just a let down this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Were at a conference at the Entertainment Centre and having the Hotel across the road was fantastic. All staff were very friendly and hotel was very clean and tidy. Close to Darling Harbour and we looked over the Chinese Gardens and Darling Harbour. Hotel room was very quiet and the Pump house restaurant had great food and service and was inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to have a break as adults, without the kids. The location was good, made it easy for us to walk to lots of destinations, both for dinner on Saturday night, and for Sunday morning shopping. Surprisingly quiet rooms, given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bed and pillows need to be reviewed. Bathrooms need to be updated. Male concierge did an outstanding job with customer service on check out. Location for me personally was not ideal. The hotel looked run down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Izzy205 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next door to Chinatown & Darling Harbour. It is easily accessed by light rail from Central station or an easy walk. There are lots of restaurants as well as food & clothing shops. Darling Harbour has taxis & ferries which takes you to Circular Quay & other locations as well. The hotel has a restaurant on site as well. Well priced for this area.

Reviews.Title: “the view is nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent view and convinence location good quality mattress very handy location if your kids want to take monorail. darling harbour is a good place for little kids to running around and you can buy a 3 days monorail ticket that gives you to access to the city and china town easily.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, dirty and uncomfortable. Do not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MadBL
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. It felt dirty and old and was terribly uncomfortable. The following problems were experienced: - the pillows were so old and uncomfortable - the duvet was old and manky, with no cover only two sheets either side - the tv had such poor signal even for internal videos - the bathroom had a drain in it which overflowed onto the floor when draining the bath - walls so thin you can hear everything in the room next door - skirting boards dirty and falling off the walls - bad room positioning couldn't watch the tv from bed I really don't recommend staying here - it's lowered my opinion of a 4 star hotel rating!

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: unspecificity
Reviews.Content: Four and a half star hotel? I can only assume that is self-rated. The pillows were just awful - well past their best. A colleague staying in another room said the spare blanket in their cupboard was thread-bare, stained, AND for a single bed (his was a queen size bed). The iron in my room dropped black flakes on my clothes when I tried to use it. The free internet available in the lobby didn't work. I tried it 3 mornings in a row. The first morning I was told that sometimes the system goes down and it'll probably be back on soon. The second morning I was told someone would come to look at it....within the hour. I had to leave, but it was still not working the next morning so presumably that never happened. On the upside - the Macs in the lobby *looked* great! The good: great location, Pumphouse restaurant (adjacent) pretty good. The bad: comfort, cleanliness, customer service. For the price you pay - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Security Expo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed staying at this hotel in the past, always in the best rooms with executive room access the coffee machine in the past was exceptional value being Nespresso but now it has taken a turn for the worse the coffe was very poor quality. I requested Nespresso in the city to come and have a word to you. If nothing has eventuated after my next visit in the near future then I probably wont be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the room could have been better. Loved the king size bed but it was as hard as a rock and the sheets were stained. I expected better quality from a Novotel & will probably not be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Night out in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very happy with the stay at Novotel Rockford. I had stayed there many years ago, and the rooms dont seem to have changed too much. There was some ageing quire noticeable in the bathroom. But we only needed the room to sleep. Staff and service were fantastic - some of the best I have experienced. Perfect location, as easy walking distance to Darling Harbour and Capitol Theatre which was the purpose of our trip. Room price was a bargain! Will be checking back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, no hiccups at all”
Reviews.Author: GinaG1983
Reviews.Content: - Arrived early and were put in a room straight away - Upgraded! stayed for 12 nights) - Nice uncrowded gym and pool - wifi in rooms and public areas but sometimes lobby computers were very slow - staff all pleasant and quick - breakfast is ridiculously prices at $30 a head - spacious and well equipped rooms - good location - lifts were quick, no hanging around

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Conference and Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very pleasant - so first impressions are great. I agree with other comments that - for the rates charged -the rooms could do with an upgrade. The modest buffet breakfast seemed pricey for what was offered. If you are going to a conference it is well positioned between the city centre and the conference centre - an easy walk to both. A fairly ordinary hotel and I felt a little pricey for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were pleasant and Helpful but the standard rooms could do with an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Tammy G
Reviews.Content: Travelling on business as a couple, arrived late 10.45pm to the hotel the reception staff were good . I had booked on online, on entry to our room we had been given two single beds and not the booked King Bed, was a bit annoying but we were too tired to request a room move. They werent given the opportunity to rectify, I am sure they would have. Overall the rooms were a little tired as was the furniture. A fresh coat of paint to remove all the marks on the wall would do wonders. The television reception cut in and out and we were situated in an end room which would double as a two bedroom room. The only real issue with noise was that the room in close proximity left and re-entered their room frequently and the noise of the closing door was irritating and loud. The hotel was close to everything we needed. We were travelling at a busy time so I suspect the $249 rate was in regards to that as the room didnt reflect the price. Overall staff were pleasant and the foyer is beautifully presented.

Reviews.Title: “Close to a lot of attractions”
Reviews.Author: GTDiver
Reviews.Content: The room on the 4th floor was clean and overlooked the small park facing the front entrance. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was modern and had enough towels and toiletries. Room service did a good job cleaning. Exercise room was a little small, but clean. Pool was nice and clean too. Staff was helpful and pleasant. The hotel is in close walking distance to Chinatown, the Expo Center, and the bars, restaurants and tourist areas in Darling Harbor. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovefivestars
Reviews.Content: Chose the Novotel Rockford as it was close to the convention centre. Location was great, hotel was fairly clean all round but the service was a bit hit and miss, often the latter. I booked an executive room for $300 per night. Check in was lousy. Waited over 10 mins and then i was asked to wait in the lobby lounge because the key cut system was down. Finally got to my room and everything appeared ok until 1am when I woke up sweating. Switched on the Aircon and the room just got hotter and hotter. went to use the look and noticed they only provided one towel and that the tissue box was empty. I then used the loo and it wouldn't flush. Call reception and the front officer guy came up to my room and noted how hot it was and stated the Aircon was broken. He couldn't get the loo to work either. As the hotel was full except for one standard room, I had no option but to move rooms. Next morning I followed up my complaint and insisted on compensation for the room downgrade ... NO I was told. I was happy and also refused to move rooms again as I was nay there for 2 nights. At checkout I spoke the manager on duty and all he did was give me his business card and suggested I contact him when I want to rebook. Well that went straight in the bin! I cannot believe the poor service. The lack of 'trying' to appease an unhappy guest was non existent. Last year we stayed at Holiday Inn and given it's slightly less standard it was certainly more comfortable. I hated every moment at Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour and will not recommend it nor stay here again. They can go to HELL.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for needs”
Reviews.Author: margaretrmrc Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel of medium price near Darling Harbour, the Powerhouse Museum and close to train ,tram and monorail this hotel fulfills those needs. Pleasant surroundings if a little noisy in some rooms. Breakfast has a good choice of fresh fruit and overall quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, Great location, We had our evening meal at The Pump House which was great. The rooms were very good.Clean and tidy, every thing you would want. The breakfast was also very good and parking was close bye.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was great although the second morning when I got out of the shower after my husband I realised that they had replaced the towels but only given us 1 instead of 2 so I had to use the same towel as my husband and it was wet. Also what we wanted on the sleep walkers menu was not available the night we ordered it but what we did get at 1pm in the morning was delicious. Would stay again service was lovely, professional, polite and very clean accommodation. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “excellence at Darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Central and easy to reach all my meetings in the City, friendly staff who went the extra mile, and just enjoyable food and service. A seamless stay that definitely supported the things I had to do on a very tight timeline. Thank you to all the staff especially Mr Joel Smellie for making me feel so welcome. I will definitely stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exhibition center”
Reviews.Author: DougA67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was close to the Sydney Exhibition centre. If you want to avoid hiring a car in sydney and you have long hours at an exhibition this is one of the best places to stay. Walking distance about 50 to 100m. For food there is a restaurant nearby called the pump house and China Town is just across the road. Walking distance to central train station or up to George st. The service at the desk can vary a little but check in was smooth. Breakfast has changed and the hot breakfast options are a lot healthier, less of the potato cakes and more eggs better bacon and sausages along with aisian options. Rooms are fairly standard, reasonable decor bigger than the Ibis rooms around the other side of Darling Harbour but air conditioning controls are very basic, fan is noisy and getting the temperature just right difficult. Internet access was included and was wireless in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only frustration i had was reception staff indicated their was valet parking for when my friend arrived, which i rang & informed him about. When he arrived to get his car taken, he was told there was NO valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: txprincess28
Reviews.Content: I was overall very pleased with this hotel- the location was great, the room was clean and well furnished although a little bit on the small side. The only surprising thing about my room was the fact that it had an older, rather large television taking up the top of the counter/dresser. I would have imagined a hotel of this caliber to have flat panel televisions in the guest rooms. That is really my only complaint. Paddys Market, Darling Harbour and just about everything in downtown Sydney is within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants of all price ranges within walking distance also. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and even return to stay again if I am ever in Sydney again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but found roach in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jef2904
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the hotel it is well located and is in good shape. the only problem is that i found a cockroach in the bathroom right before checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Novotel we thought it was!”
Reviews.Author: traveller201051
Reviews.Content: We were expecting to stay in the other one, but were not disappointed by our room. The housekeeping though is terrible - we had dirty looking towels (hit and miss if we even got the right number!), the bed was made badly or not made at all, and the surfaces need a good clean. When I mentioned this to the front desk, they were very helpful but it seems to have not been acted on by housekeeping. Location is not ideal - not on a tram or bus stop, and views are not incredible. Next to the Chinese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant,Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELEMSYDNEY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Rockford after securing a great Accor deal, this hotel is not to be confused with the Novotel at Darling Harbour... I was travelling with a family member and the only requirments we had were a clean place to lay our wiery heads after a big day shopping and this place exceeded my expectations, The location is excellent, Straight across from sydney entertainment centre, paddys markets,China Town, within walking distance to central darling harbour and quick axcess to the cbd with the monorail virtually on the door step. A twin room was fresh and modern, a little small if you wanted to hang out but this didnt bother us. We had a quick dinner at the pump house, the restuarant that is located at the rear of the hotel The staff were very friendly and the meal was excellent, service fast. I would definatly stay here again, after many a time paying top dollar to stay at premium hotels in the city. Tip: Park in the entertainment centre carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked with your hotel as it was close to the boat show. We got a very goor rate but were disapponted with the room: Scuff marks on wall opposite bed Dirty bathroom floor on arrival No spoon to stir coffee next morning TV at a bad angle if lying in bed. Did not see the dearer rooms so cannot comment on their quality

Reviews.Title: “Rockford Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Rockford on business and was very happy with the room, location and service. I felt that for the price the room was nicely furnished and had everything that you would usually get in a 4 star hotel. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Darling Harbour and car parking is available next door at the Entertainment Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good and convenience, but the service was poor. The reception staff response slow. It looked like a 3 star hotel more than a named 4 star hotel. Lucky we go out all of the day, it was convenience for come back overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Marina709
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for New Year 2010. The hotel is nice, average. There is nothing bad, but also nothing so great to point out. The location is very near the Darling Harbour so it is a good location. We found it very annoying that we couldn't open any windows. Also the air-condition was bad. The hotel is OK, but don't expect too much. Our holiday was based on exploring Sydney and for that the hotel offered everything we needed - a bed and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & NOT A HIGH RISE”
Reviews.Author: speaktruly
Reviews.Content: If you are uncomforable with staying on really high floors and being in lifts for a lengthy trip up and down (like me) then you will love it more as it only has 8 floors. Situated opposite the Sydney entertainment center the hotel offers subsidised (only $25 per day) car parking at the huge car park almost next door. Only a short stroll to Dixon St., the center of Chinatown and a fantastic variety of restaurants and night life as well as the City Markets and most public transport. We enjoyed it all and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception Staff Non Welcoming. Food Excellent, Bar and Restaurant Staff Excellent Bed Terrible. Left with sore back. Evening Restaurant Not acceptable ambience. Perfect for bar meals. Disappointing unable to return to our room via internal door due to private function, made to walk in pouring rain after a lovely meal getting soaking wet on the exterior of hotel back through reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Janny_9
Reviews.Content: A nice weekend stay at this hotel for a Show and Football. The location was fabulous for our needs, easywalking distance to the theatre and a little longer walk to SCG. The entertainment centre is opposite and China Town a stones throw away. Staff were friendly although I did feel housekeeping did let the side down, the room was left unserviced one day and the following days although towels were changed , the bed was poorly remade, with the covers merely pulled up. Staff were very quick to bring extra teabags etc to the room once we mentioned the room had not been serviced. Overall I found Novotel to be comfortable and clean. I would definately stay again at Novotel Rockford if we again found a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
