Reviews.Content: fantastic place to stay, close to everything and everything u need in hotel for relaxing stay. Rooms were comfortable and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visting sydney for its location and service provided

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Penesloppy
Reviews.Content: A lot of reviews here are quite damning of this hotel, but our room was refurbished and although a little cramped for space it had a good sized bathroom which was fairly new looking and an LCD tv (with not so good reception). Staff were courteous and the breakfast wasn't the Hilton but was better than a lot I've had in other hotels. We booked a year before so got it at a fantastic price, breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “great location very noisy hotel could hear every word the people were saying in the room next to us...”
Reviews.Author: Holidaydreamer88 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: needs a good update rooms are paper thin could hear conversations in the room next to us and kew when they were showering ! beds were very comfortable great location just over all needs a update. Reception staff were very accomodating and breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Polite and helpful staff. Room was great and bed very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. Had to wait up to fifteen minutes for the lifts but it wasn't a real problem...........................................................

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Hillsong Conference 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hillsong Conference was held in Sydney Entertainment Centre next door. We were blessed to stay at Novotel Rockford! A neat and tidy hotel with good amenities. Parts of hotel undergoing refurbishment - will add to the appeal. Enjoyed hearty breakfasts daily as part of the package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you have any reason to be in Sydney city's south - near the Entertainment Centre, Uni, or Chinatown - there is No Better place to stay - convienient to the transport hub, entertainment precinct and food 24/7. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “work trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and has a great location,in the Darling Harbour area of the city Only draw back was the breakfast - very ordinary -dried out sausages and scrambled eggs and not considered value for the $30. The kitchen may have been busy but someone should have kept an eye on te quality and condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 767DeniseSydney767 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location next door to entertainment Centre and with in walking distance to State Theatre . China town and darling harbour . Paddy's market 2 minutes away. Quiet rooms. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sgct Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Rockford to attend the Good Food & Wine Show at Darling Harbour. The location was perfect for that. The hotel is OK and we had no problems this time. the room was OK, nothing fancy and it was an upgrade. The hotel is attached to the Pumphouse which is pretty good for casual meals and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ozrick33Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Very convenient located near Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The room was very clean, bedding comfortable and bathroom big. The room service was very good and the buffer breakfast extensive and fresh. Only downside was the coffee with breakfast. The coffee from the automatic self service machine was not pleasant at all. Ordered a barista coffee, at extra cost which was good.

Reviews.Title: “kind of disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Mercure Parramatta for two days before move into this hotel, which is the first time to stay in as well. According to the ranking, Novotel should have the higher rate and I was exciting about it. But once getting into the room, it quite small after fitting two single bed. And even found a quite obvious lip mark on the cups. The most ridiculous is the television is such an old style (fat square case and not even 32"), which you may only find in the countryside motel. However, the next day on the way out. I glimpsed other room while house keeping let the door opened. I can see a new flat LCD tv inside. Thus I must be the bad luck having the old style tv room. If anyone want to book this hotel, would be good to double check. And I really think Novotel shall have their standard. I also used the gym room which is another disappointment. The facility is okay but not much weight training. And the room is central control, I was feeling very cold once getting in. The tv in the gym also play muscle training dvd only. I could not choose other channel. But problems do not exist in Mercure. Location wise, it is great. Near china town and easy getting foods. For the business in exhibition centre, only couple of minute away. Overall, it is a good place to stay. Just with the name of their hotel, really hope they will improve more. (did I forget to mention, the room even does not have a safety box.)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Rockford as we werecoming up from the country to go to a show and also an event at the Exhibition Centre. This hotel is perfectly placed for both. An ideal location. The valet parking was fantastic and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Our friends who also stayed there were happy too.

Reviews.Title: “Geoff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, excellent staff, perhaps the breakfast let the venue down marginly. The hotel is extremely convenient to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the Entertainment Centre with excellent public transport available.

Reviews.Title: “Location at a price”
Reviews.Author: JimmyGeelong
Reviews.Content: Location location..... That is the only thing this place has going for it! $225 a night - twin room of two singles, shower curtain, sink that was faulty, tv ...... Anologue tv!!! 34cm tv!! I threw two of these TV's out when digital tv come into play. The decor of this hotel is disgraceful - ONLY stay here if you want location! Worse $700 dollars I have spent on a hotel. Come on accor do something about these places that mascarade as 4-4.5 star hotels. Your hiding behind the name.

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel approx 6.30pm and was told that the room was not ready, we then had to wait for another staff member to allocate another room. We got to the room and the roll out bed which we booked for was not in there. I phoned reception who said they would get to it immediately I also asked for a towel for my daughter. 20 minutes later the bed arrived and the towel came too, but on use of the towel it was frayed and had holes. I feel as booking with the family, my family was not catered for. We specifically booked this hotel as it had an indoor heated pool, but to our dissappointment it was closed. The only note that was left on the bad was that the GYM was not in use no mention of the pool. If the pool was to be repaired you should let customers know on the internet that this was being carried out and for how long it was going to take. Not sure if I would recommend especially to friends with family. The only positive was the waitress at breakfast who greeted my daughter and had a lovely manner about her. I made mention of this to management I only hope that was passed on to her (her name started with P).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice now and are recommending it to family and friends for its central location. A short leisurely stroll to Darling Harbour, a few steps from China Town, an easy walk to the city. Rooms were great, heating and air conditioning in working order and the breakfast basic, but delicious. Check in and check out were efficient and all the staff very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service,Excellent Location,”
Reviews.Author: marvica Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for my stay at the Novetel Rockford Darling Harbour Hotel. From the moment I signed in at the front office to my departure the staff were most helpful. The hoitel is located in a fantastic are with easy access to where I needed to go. The room was comfortable and clean. Certainly it is my future preference when staying in Sydney. Thank s to all the staff who made my few days enjoyable France Radford Geraldton

Reviews.Title: “Good location , small rooms”
Reviews.Author: wilfredog
Reviews.Content: Great location and well priced . Rooms are small and looking a bit tired but generaly a good hotel.Pump house is a great place for a beer.

Reviews.Title: “room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very good, the bed was very comfortable and the view was lovely. I thought it was weird that although we booked the room for two people there was only 1 robe and 1 pair of slippers provided as part of our package. I still have not had my refund for finding a cheaper price on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Cyberchick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, but this time I was very dissapointed. The room was far from clean

Reviews.Title: “3night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights did not change sheets. Rooms very small for best room and tv reception not good Great location Too expensive for room size and quality. Breakfast good. Parking not in building so if raining not good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonboi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Great location Easy walk to central and shopping. Room wasn't ready so left bags when returned already in room. Our room had a massive bathroom. Only complaint would be tv signal not the greatest.

Reviews.Title: “more like highway motel than 41/2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: friseur13
Reviews.Content: Stay for 2 night at Rockford Darling Harbour, very good location very close to China Town but the hotel itself is not a good place to relax and sleep, very noisy room from the car & truck passing by 24/7. Television has very limited channel and the picture was not very good, the swimming pool is under construction, also high speed internet is very expensive $ 30.00 / 24hrs. Big disapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Griffiths Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable in the room - not big rooms but everything you need. Very clean and great views over Darling Harbour. We would definitely stay again. The front desk service was great and location very central for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “too much road noise makes sleep impossible”
Reviews.Author: ajm045
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to have to review this hotel so negatively but my room faced a 6 lane highway which made sleep impossible and the primary function of a hotel is to give you a place to sleep. It adversely affected my whole stay in sydney because I was so tired all the time. It might be slightly better to have a room facing the entertainment centre (unless there was an event on) but I saw noisy youths with boom boxes hanging out there on saturday night so noise might still be a problem. There was also noise affecting my room (partying from somewhere) on friday night. Internally it was one of the quieter hotels I have stayed in, so it was a shame it was ruined by road noise. The other big disappointment was the swimming pool being out of order. I did not find out about it until I went to the pool with my bathers under my arm. No mention on the website or at reception or in the room. I was also told I could not have a bathrobe because I was not in a deluxe room (how petty) but when I also complained about the pool being out of order a robe was sent up. I had a very average, quite pricey, buffet breakfast one day (and not again). 'Barista' coffee was extra. Again, petty on a $30 breakfast. As I said, it's a shame to review it so negatively when otherwise it was comparable to other hotels in its class, and was considerably cleaner than some. But the road noise was intolerable. Double glazed windows would help a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Rockford is a comfortable hotel to stay in. Close to the many attractions in Sydney. A good walk to the CBD of Sydney. The Pumphouse restaurant is most enjoyable and would be a great place to enjoy a warm summer evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed here before surprised at how close it is to Darling Harbour area. Our room overlooked the Chinese Gardens. Carpark was 2 minute walk away. walking distance to everything. Across the road from the entertainment centre .enjoyed our stay. Would recommend to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful, especially Freddy in the bar downstairs. Location is fantastic with ease of access to all places. Rooms lovely & clean & really quite competitive for Sydney. Well done guys.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus, no fuss.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy walking distance to Exhibition Centre and China town. I was staying there on business. Room was clean, had a big bathroom and flat screen tv. I did my booking on line which was easy but on check-out I was in-correctly charged and I had to show my booking confirmation to correct the rate. Internet was not free in the room, but luckily I had hot-spot in my iphone. I would stay there again, its no fuss and good location.

Reviews.Title: “No one knows where this place is!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HSE
Reviews.Content: We jumped in a taxi gave the name and address and the taxi driver had no idea!!!!!!!! We drove round and round and round for ages and eventually stumbled across it! This was our 3rd Novotel in our Oz trip and wasn't the best! Rooms dull and bland and no safe which was disappointing. The breakfast was small and we felt rushed, also some queries as to whether we had breakfast included which we did but it again seemed a hassle. The location........ if you can, stay down at Circular Quay or the Rocks and be in the heart of Sydney. We only stayed for one night thankfully before moving down to the Quay West Suites. Our advice is you only get what you pay for in Sydney and this hotel is proof of that.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Facilites somewhat tired. Difficult loaction for Taxi and Collegues to access by car. Room was of a godo size but sufferred from a lot of Traffic noise, which made it hard to sleep which is my one requirement from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the traveller.”
Reviews.Author: GFWVictoria Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was very good, rooms clean and comfortable. Breakfast is your typical standard nothing too special. Only problem is the parking when it rains. The parking is located approx 150mtrs from the hotel at the convention center. Also as always it is hard to navigate to the hotel with so many one way streets, however this is not the hotels fault its just Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Rockford ,Its central to all the great spots in Sydney,You can walk everwhere or its close to the Monorail,Light rail and Buses.Also next to theEntertainment cenre,Best of all 2mins from China Town.Rooms on the Chinese Gardens side are great,Staff very friendly.Would reccomend anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with the hotel. It is in walking distance to most the CBD and transport. It would have been better if the Monorail station opposite the hotel was open. It would have saved us a lot of time

Reviews.Title: “Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Rockford is well located to enjoy all that Sydney has to offer either by foot,train or metro rail tram.The facilities at the Rockford where excellent and the staff pleasant and attentive The only let down was the buffet breakfast,a great range of offerings but at best served luke warm.The Rockford may be wise to invest in food servers that have lids as I was not the only guest to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of plus'”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed all aspects of our stay here...... very friendly and polite staff, great location and quality all round! The car parking was the only disappointment - we weren't informed car parking was an additional cost of $25 daily (Entertainment Centre Carpark). Loved the Pumphouse Restaurant & Bar. Great place for drinks & nibbles and obviously very popular. A little pricey but a nice experience. Located just around the corner from the Chinese Gardens made a visit a must. Highly recommend you do the same. Easy walking distance to many points of interest including Entertainment/ Convention Centres & Harbourside shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for Darling Harbour, China Town and Geroge Street area. Nothing flash but clean and adequate if a little basic . $25 for 24hour parking in parking station close by. Area felt safe. A little bit of an issue finding the hotel as not clearly marked.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Lillythetraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is handy, close to Chinatown! Booked on wotif wouldn't of been happy if we paid full price. Linen was nice but the bed was terrible hard as concrete I think if it new beds carpet and a lick of paint would make the world of difference! Check in and out was easy! Best part of my stay where the slippers...

Reviews.Title: “If I could rate it a zero, I would.”
Reviews.Author: thewattos
Reviews.Content: Rubbish. This is as bad as the 'Mister Bed' I stayed in, in France. The concierge staff were rude. They didn't believe that they had a booking for me (even though I booked online through a well known website) Took 15 minutes for them to find my booking. Then we got a room, that was, at best, a 3 star. Dirty walls and a bathroom with plenty of mould (for me to even pick that up, it must be bad..) The walls are paper thin. You could hear a pin drop next door. Unfortunately for my partner and I, the sounds of large mammals mating (albeit not that long) was far worse than any pin......Then there was breakfast. The breakfast, they for some reason wasn't included on the 2nd day. Even though it was. They acknowledged their mistake as we were checking out. A bit late.. Overall, a shocking hotel, rude staff and a complete waste of time and money staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice to stay nearby Chinatown, Darling Harbour and great place to dine close by. Definitely recommended anyone to stay here again. Be back soon! Paddy Market is just a minute walk by and have many stuff to buy. Love shopping there and surely got some bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the pool being closed for maintenance (not a smart idea on school holidays!!!), overall quite a good value hotel. Rooms are clean and fairly basic, but as usual the bedding was superbly comfortable. But take your own hair dryer ladies...only hotel I have ever been to where there was no hair dryer provided in the rooms. A bit of a hike from any of the train stations which was a pain with tired kids and heavy suitcases coming from the airport but otherwise pretty close to DArling HArbour and the free shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brenno23
Reviews.Content: My partner and I book this hotel for the location primarily - great location, very convenient. The service however well below that expected for a hotel proclaiming to be of the quality it states. On check-in, there were two persons behind the counter. One of which was assisting another guest with an issue. The other was typing on one of the computers. We stood at the counter for 5 minutes without being so much as acknowledged by either of the staff. Our room was ok - tired, but ok. The 'Fitness Centre' was in a room not much bigger than the bedrooms. One treadmill, a cross trainer, stepper and a couple of fixed weight stations. The late night room service menu was not extensive, however, we tried our luck with nachos and cake. The nachos were disgusting. Mince on a plate topped with very a tiny bit of cheese, then corn chips spread out on top - havent seen nachos done like this before! The chocolate cake was inedible! It was tasetless, and chewy. We left both of these relatively untouched. The evening prior to check-out we asked for our vehicle (vallet parked) to be available for 9:30am. When we arrived at reception to check out, low and behold, no vehicle. Again, we were not acknowledged whilst standing behind the counter - not even a "we'll be with you soon". While we were waiting, we interrupted one of the staff behind the counter to ask for the concierge. The girl replied that we would have to wait. As it turns out, the concierge heard us and came out. We asked for our car. Once one of the girls behind the counter eventually did get around to us, our bill was produced which showed we'd been double charged... It's an easy fix, but not something that should be expected, nor that we should have to be looking for. The check out experience all up took 20 minutes. That didnt matter though, because by the time our car arrived back from vallet parking, it had been 45 minutes all up. Very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was included and both days we were told it was not. I had to go back up to my room before breakfast to show the confirmation. My boss wanted to have a cup of coffee from the breakfast area at 6:25am and was told he could not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very happy with everything, could not have been better, the rooms where neat and tidy with all the mod cons, the staff could not do enough for us, they made us feel very welcome, and just next door to the entertainment centre, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Novotel Rockford was great. The room was clean and nicely furnished, with an adequate amount of space. The accommodation was close to great restaurants by the harbour and other locations. Parking was conveniently located. Check in and check out was smooth, with the room available for early check in.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it took me over half an hour to check in! then when checking out i almost missed my bus because the guy was struggling to find my booking. Then i find out i have been charged twice!! Lady said she will call me back today it is now 9:40pm and i still haven't heard a thing.will never stay at Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff for their caring and understanding when my son was sick in the room. I was very grateful for all their help. Apart from that, we had a wonderful stay. The hotel was close to everything that we wanted, and I will certainly be booking to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, quite, right next to convention centre”
Reviews.Author: FromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: needs a lick of paint however the staff made up for the inadequacies.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, easy walking to Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay restaurants, and slap in Chinatown but far enough from the touristy part of Darling Harbour. Easy walking to the city centre, Paddys Market and right next door to the Entertainment Centre. Parking is a bit expensive, but it is Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Frist i was told one price for breakfast then i was charged another price. Breakfast wasn't value for the money,i was over charged for breakfast twices found a hair with my food ,When i told the waiter done nothing about it i had to tell another waiter when she when and done the right thing .We have been to many accor hotels not just in australia also in overseas and never hear that they charge more for thr mumbers of accor when they eat in the hotel like your.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous position”
Reviews.Author: sidmothian
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good position for Sydney, the chinese quarter was across the road and the food court was very reasonable and delicious fresh food. Hotel room very good, choice of pillows and the bed was wonderful. Swimming pool good. Free internet for booking flights excellent. Easy walk to Darling Harbour. Only down side was the restaurant manager he was really rude to everyone at breakfast, he needed customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to Darling Harbour, China Town and Capitol Theatre. We also used it as a base for travel by car to western and north eastern suburbs, all of which worked out well. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Breakfast was very adequate with a wide variety of self-service choices. The room was comfortable and suitably equipped. Whilst the hotel is not spectacular, it served our purposes very well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LindaLong88 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I don't know the employees name but she deserves a raise! She drove my wallet and prescription sun glasses to an airport hotel (Formula 1 Sydney) because I left them in the Novatel's lobby. We were going to Cains and then returning to the Formula 1 before heading for home. I am so impressed with the honesty of this employee and wish I could personally thank her. All of my money and credit cards were safe and sound when I returned to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: Kate4967 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As Accor Advantage member I was upset to pay $310 for one night; that is dearer than the Sofitel which provides bigger room and much better hotel facilities. We couldn't get a table for breakfasts and there were long queues for checking out. NOT GOOD

Reviews.Title: “Decent,convenient location,bit far from CBD center.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_CE
Reviews.Content: It's your typical 4-star Novotel, clean and comfortable. It's right next to Chinatown and the Entertainment Center. In terms of the location it's very good as it's close to all forms of public transport including the trains,buses, monorail. So getting food is very easy and most of the restaurants in chinatown opens till late. My only complain is that it's right next to a major road so the road noise does get through the rooms. It's bit far from the CBD center though still within walking distance. there are other novotels in sydney ,and two of them in darling harbour. most taxi drivers here have no clues, so check first.

Reviews.Title: “Below service standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the service we received at this Hotel. Firstly, we paid for an upgrade to an executive suite but when we went to the room it was a standard room despite us giving reception the paperwork to verify this. On pointing out the error no apology was given or assistance to relocate our luggage to a different floor was offered. Our first room servicing was inadequate. Bed not properly made, coffee cups not washed and hand towel not replaced. However our second room service was good. The TV was not working at first but was fixed quickly however we asked for a TV guide but did not get one delivered. Coffee machine in executive lounge was broken and was not fixed. In this case, this was not up to the standard we expect from Accor Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BillKiwi
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour, China Town, the City all very close and easy to access. Great value for money with great room, excellent local bar/restaurant (Pump House). Will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4.5 star quality”
Reviews.Author: GJW8
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a great location next to Darling Harbour, it is over-priced and definitely not a 4.5 star hotel. The rooms were clean and light but very small and the hotel doesn't have a lot of atmosphere. The reception staff were not really that friendly either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but all the extra's are frustrating”
Reviews.Author: chocolat61
Reviews.Content: While the location is perfect for a Sydney city trip - near the whole Darling Harbour scene and very near to buzzling Chinatown - the hotel is a little difficult to get to by car and the rates for the parking are expensive. Then again, I would not take a rental car next time in Sydney anyway...What really frustrated me, there were two screens in teh entrance area, where you could log on to the Internet for 20 mins, but if you wanted WIFI or connection in your room, you just pay another roughly 30 A$. I just think this is not reasonable any longer. Internet shoudl just be there and free. Hotel pool small (ok), but with a chlorine content that just burned on my skin and I had to get out. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Volatile stay in down under”
Reviews.Author: juedpa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a background I have spent during past two years 80+ nights in Accor-groups hotels around the world but mostly in Europe, in Novotels and Pullman. Based on the experiences from these stays I decided to choose Novotel in Sydney to be the primary accommodation during 2 week honey moon in Australia. Of this two weeks we spent 13 nights in Novotel Darling Harbour in executive floor in two different rooms. My experiences of Novotels have been excellent which also set my expectations to be high. Upon arrival after travelling 34 hours of which 21 spent in plane, we were exhausted. Check in went well, but we were not informed of additional services of the hotel, which were included in our package (executive lounge, free internet). From this started the era, which finally ended up in creation of a new slogan to hotel: " Never right the first time". First thing after exhausting travel you want to take a shower and get some food. So what happened was that after getting some water and having rubbed yourself with soap & shampoo the water stopped. Response from reception was that there should have been information of stoppage and maybe you should go to pool. Well no information anywhere, after a discussion a new towel was gotten to get rid of the soap while waiting the 20min for water supply to continue. Getting to the food part continued on the same path, my wife has some diatery restrictions and she is pregnant. So we made an order to room service and specified clearly the restrictions, but still got the salade including non wanted components. At this point I got frustrated and contacted the concierge and gave some feedback. What proved to be the strong point of this hotel was the ability to take seriously the feedback in professional manner. We got a bottle of sparkling wine and a apologies from a friendly concierge. These problems of having to every now and then to ask for further improvements continued during the stays. We had to ask towels to be replaced (supposedly clean towels were full of other people hair + holes), open the safety box which was closed from the previous customer, some times shampoo and soap were refilled sometimes not etc. BUt everytime we asked for service, we got it from friendly staff. So all in all some sloppiness was replaced and having a honey moon such minor things could not ruin the good mood. Two bigger items I would still raise up. First of all putting any people to rooms having a non-sound proof door between rooms is totally irresponsible. During one of the nights spent in room 804, we could actually hear the neighbour snoring and even the words of a low toned discussion. Second was the hotel restaurant Pumphouse. As explained above, my wife has dietary restriction requiring gluten-free meal. So we ordered one and waiter was very clear on what items contained gulten and what not, one of containing was soy-sauce, so the portion was to be delivered without it. After 20min or so food was brought by different waiter and we noticed the sauce on the plate. After (me) having a taste and my wife checking and wondering whether it was soy or not, we decided to return the plate. What happened was that the waiter brought in 2 minutes a new portion, which was clearly the old one wiped from the soy. We could see the soy stains in rice and the fish was still from the bottom covered with the soy. Further discussion with the waiter brought us a new dish and price reduction, but I would never recommend the dinner services of this hotel to anyone. So having these said as a summary. The hotel has a nice and friendly staff, the breakfeast buffet was okay and especially its staff was the best part of our stay. Hotel makes a lot of small things wrong, but is also fixing these if you ask to. Due to experiences of Novotel in other parts of the world I had high standards, which were not met, but in overall the visit was ok. My advice would be, that if you get a special discount (e.g. Accor hot deals) this can be value for money or at least an average stay, but with full price, I would never do it. So when having 3,5 stars with price of 4 stars, not worth it but having 3,5 stars with price of 3, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our second stay because of the hotel's great location; next to Chinese Gardens, Chinatown, and near Exhibition Buildings, Cockle Bay Wharf, Darling Harbour and the Capitol Theatre. No need for taxis as it's an easy half hour stroll to The Art Gallery, Botanic Gardens, The Rocks and Opera House through the CBD. Hotel rooms have been refurbished since our first stay and are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A group of six couples went to Sydney for a birthday celebration for three days. I booked a room under my name for ourselves and one other couple. First morning, I rang reception for towels to the pool area before going for a swim but twenty minutes later they still had not turned up. We had to dry ourselves with used towels! On the second night the tap in the shower broke. We were not too concerned as this type of thing happens at times and we were promised another room for the next day, although it was a nuisance to have to pack up half way through our stay. We went out during the day and were given a new room key when we returned in the afternoon - opened the door and walked in on one of our friends sitting on the toilet! They had given us the key to the other room we had booked under my name. After getting the correct room, the whole group went to the attached restaurant for dinner. On returning, our friends discovered they had been locked out of their room because reception had cancelled their key! We also left our phone charger in the first room. It was not until we asked for it that they figured out it belonged to the couple who had been moved 3 rooms away. The manager was very apologetic about the problems that had occurred. It was a very nice hotel in a great location but I'm afraid the reception staff just seemed like zombies with no initiative or personality.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our night out.It is close to china town and the markets which is handy for some

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Itayed at The Rockford Novotel over 4 days from 11th to 15th February. Myself and my wife, Found it to be central to many attractions at a good price, if one is an A-Club / advantge plus card holder . With paddys market, the entertainment centre and china town at your door step, With Darling harbour only a 10 min leisurely walk from the hotel. Have stayed at The Rockford Novotel many times over the years, and will keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: bjones45
Reviews.Content: My wife and used our Advantage Plus complimentary night in this hotel. No problems in booking. The room was large, clean and had great views overlooking the Chinese Gardens in Darling Harbour. Staff were very good. The location is within walking distance to downtown Sydney and Darling Harbour. The Hotel is connected to the Pumphouse Brewery which has a great range of national and international beers. Duriing our stay Norwegian beer was on tap although at $10 a glass you will need your plastic

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Value, and Location”
Reviews.Author: teacherkh
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of their Early Breaks rate and spent 4 nights at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour at the end of January. Sydney is a very expensive city, but by prepaying for our room with full breakfast, we got a wonderful rate at an excellent hotel in a great location. Since we had trip insurance, we didn't feel that prepaying would cause us any difficulty if a problem arose. We arrived on Australia Day and were able to easily join the crowds around Darling Harbour by walking the short 5 minute walk to the center of all of the evening activities. The full hot breakfast was delicious, and the staff was always very helpful. My mom needed a handicapped accessible room which was roomy and gave her all of the helpful amenities that a 90-year-old would need. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Feb”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and good location but breakfast was a big let down and room wasn't that new.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Weekend in hot Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great especially the Pump Room restaurant. However, extremely hot in Sydney that weekend and the Pump Room does not have air conditioning and the blinds don't protect diners from the evening sum, so dinner was a little uncomfortable. The food was great, good service and a perfect location close to monorail, light rail and water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Executive loung upgrade a load of rip off”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't ever opt to upgrade to the executive lounge, it was terrible. No service, Coffee machine broken, Bar area dirty and unsafe. No snacks and the only drinks available were cold bottled water and jugs of uncovered juice in a large taky looking fridge with no lables to indicate out of date or when they were put in the fridge. I was offered a coffee to be bought to my room which took 45 min and was stone cold when it arrived. Management took little notice and did not offer to remove the extra charge from my bill. I can't beleive it is 4 star ... it is a joke. I have visited many executive lounges and this was memorable for all the wrong reason's...don't be ripped off stay away from it ,if you have to use this hotel. I am still waiting for the manager to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: succeed_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour (be aware, there are 2 Novotels in Darling Harbour). It was right beside Chinatown, literally across the street from the monorail stop, and a very easy walk to the main street, George St which was only 2 blocks away. George Street (the part we stayed near) has banking machines, restaurants, shops, and grocery stores (Coles & Woolworths). The free CBD 555 Shuttle Bus also runs along George St., so this hotel is well situated. There were 3 different train stations that were only 10-15 minutes walk away. So everything was very handy. Our room was on the second floor, and there was no noise at all except for 2 occasions when there was a loud truck that rolled by on the street outside in the middle of the night. However, that noise lasted just a couple of seconds each time, so it didnâ€™t really disturb our sleep. The hotel had 2 free internet terminals in the lobby and usually there was only a very short wait to get one. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and bright. I would highly recommend the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scarz Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location, very close to Paddy's Market, The Entertainment Centre/ Convention Centre, Chinese Gardens, Darling Harbour, Sydney's main street and Central Station. It is only about three minutes walk to the Monorail and Light Rail. The rooms were clean and we had good views. The only draw back for us was that we booked two rooms (one for our Daughters) and was advised by email that they would be adjoining and this was confirmed on check-in, although one of the rooms wasn't ready at that time. When we collected the room key later for the second room, they were not adjoining at all. However, that is the only issue we had. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was initially concerned about the location next to the busy road, but the hotel is well insulated from noise and this was not a problem. Convenient location to Darling Harbour, Chinatown and QVB. Staff were very courteous and the room (king) was comfortable and spacious. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor services, rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: feelingtrip
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to Chinatown and CBD, but poor services, strange breakfast(and rude staff there too). I would not say this hotel is even 3 stars! Lots of motels are better than this hotel in term of services. Not any more.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy up and keeo it simple.”
Reviews.Author: frankEngland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs a little bit of smartening up. Looks "tired". Breakfast food should be simpler, or with a choice of "au naturel" food without the addition of herbs, spices, and garnishes.

Reviews.Title: “Mother & daughter shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Rockford - rooms clean with everything you can need. Recommend staying in king deluxe as wifi included with no charge. Staff pleasant and restaurant caters well for all. Will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Definately wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: AucklandTripsta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 7 nights in January. Warning to those travelling with children - We had booked and prepaid online for a room with 2 adults and 1 child. Our booking documents said 'Accommodation and buffet breakfast are free for two children under the age of 16 staying in their parents' or grandparents' room and having breakfast as a family'. However when we arrived there was no bed for the child that we had booked for. After raising this at the front desk they apologised for their mistake and bought in a rollaway bed. When we checked out they tried to charge for the bed but after we showed them the documents they agreed that it was included. Upon returning to NZ I found they had charged my credit card 2 days after we left for $280NZD! When I rang to enquire they advised the bed is only free if it is in the room, and so even though we booked and paid for a room with a child they chose to not give us a bed then charged us for a rollaway. I've never come across this before and when trying to clarify the situation the manager I spoke to was very rude. After 3 toll calls to them they eventually agreed to credit the charge but were adament that it was normal procedure. The customer service was really poor and is definately enough to put me off ever staying there again. The overall quality and condition of the hotel is average, quite dated, small rooms and very unhelpful staff - would give it a 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “BYO Kids NOT!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: making a booking was easy however booking in was not the best. It all started with our family deciding to take a family holiday to Sydney. We found a great deal with Novotel for the three of us - yes my husband, myself and our four year old. on arrival I was informed that our room only had a king size bed. This was meant to fit the three of us. If you have ever slept with a four year you know that they kick like nothing else and need their own bed. However our "friendly" (NOT) clerk stated that we needed to hire a rollaway if we wanted a third bed at a cost of $30 per night. As we were on a pretty tight budget we opted out so instead we were faced with two painful sleepless nights with a four year in our bed. Then to add salt to our wounds the sheets were stained and looked like they had not been changed. So would I recommend this hotel and the answer is NO!!!

Reviews.Title: “wedding party”
Reviews.Author: travelleroz81 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the main girl on reception very nice. think Nicole was her name.thanks for the upgrades for my best friends wedding. bfast supervisor not as friendly.seemed stressed out. came in w 6 people. told us would take 30min.we explained that we have a time scedule because of the wedding.we offered to spitt us up.would be still 20min. was his answer even we saw 3 empty tables.we got the tables than.after he saw that i work for accor he told me "i should know how it works"(his words).and he doesn't seem to know the staff discounts either.restaurant erea seemed really small for the amount of guest in house. otherwise nice stay.thank you

Reviews.Title: “Location Does Not Get Better”
Reviews.Author: william94 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in beautiful room. Location is so perfect for everything. Was able to see so much of Sydney from such a wonderful base. I will be staying again

Reviews.Title: “small bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely 3 days except for lack of sleep, it is the first time in 30 years i've had to squeeze into a double bed.

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: in the area where the food is served by onesself I suggest a hand sanitizer be installed to protect the health of your guests (similar those on cruise ships). WE found the room house person to be well above standard (tall Chris)esuring our room was kept up to a very high level of cleanliness, with No disruption to us.We found the food at the hotel very good but could not reccomend the Pumphouse next door or the beer!!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: hawdownunder Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location overlooking the Chinese Gardens and a leafy common near Darling Harbour. It is convenient for Paddy's Market, Chinatown, The Maritime Museum cinemas and the Capitol Theatre. The staff are welcoming and the adjoining Pump House is atmospheric. Buffet breakfast is often included in the tariff and offers a good range of choice in a pleasant cafe, though there is quite a time lag in re-filling hot food stations. King size beds are comfortable and there is an indoor lap pool and gym for the energetic as well as opportunities to jog along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 007jan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! walked everywhere from hotel - Darling harbour,Chinatown, Circular Quay. Surrounded by a plethora of restaurants. Prompt service by staff at all times. Did think the breakfast was over priced at $30 AU. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience, very average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was at a good location about 10min walk to the center of darling harbour, however we got there about 12noon and were advised the room will be ready at 2pm, at 2.30pm we were told it will take another another 1hr for the room to be ready which wasnt attractive option, then the receptionist organized us another room given that we were not happy with the outcome. The swimming poor was not available for over 24hrs, we were advised it needed cleaning. I

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Rockford Jan 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was a little too small for 2 adults and a 6yr old child. Bath was too narrow - shower was over bath and adults had no flat part in bath to stand on was awkward. A couple of times room service only gave us 2 towels. Had to get the key card redone at reception a couple of times. Was not my best experience at a Novotel Hotel - felt more like Ibis standard.

Reviews.Title: “Night after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location and all the staff are very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Awash in a sea of generic hotels...”
Reviews.Author: wendyinafrica
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 5, so necessitated two rooms. One we booked was an exec room with access to the Club, and views of the chinese gardens....this is a con...the Club is nothing like a Club it consisted of a coffee machine, a large TV, some computors, and a few chairs...there was a sign that said if you needed help ring...the kids room included a great breakfast, the exec room didn't and we paid $30 each (seriously what a rip off)...we asked for late check out..one person said $70 till 4pm, when we went to confirm we were told that this was not possible as staff change over at 3pm and that was $60.00...oh well... Its a great location...don't expect anything other than a reasonable bed..shop around for the cheapest rate...and don't bother booking any extra's like an exec club room...its simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family and a child to Sydney where I wanted to show them the Darling Habour and Opera House etc. These are best attractions and famous scenery of Sydney as we were only stopped over Sydney for 2 days. Novotel Htel Darling Harbour was the right choice that I managed to get the sightseeing, shopping and dining at the Pier done in 2 days time. The hotel service and cleanliness were very good. Staff are all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jpy1963
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 recently stayed for a night on our return from overseas. As it was Christmas week we were unable to get a reasonably priced room to fit all five of us for the one night. We were lucky enough to get two rooms at the Novotel including breakfast for less than $300. The chek-in staff were excellent, we were upgraded to the King Deluxe rooms which were nice but nothing special. The location was the best thing - easy walking distance to Darling Harbour, Monorail, Train Station and Ferries. The breakfast in the morning was good but I would have to say the staff working on that day were really poor (bordering on rude) and not to the same standard of the rest of the staff. We were able to store all our luggage for the day at the hotel without any fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, however we wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Babblez
Reviews.Content: I left the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour with a bit of a sour taste in my mouth. Check in and check out was easy, location was great, views of the Chinese gardens were pretty cool, and we found our bed quite comfortable, but that's where the pleasantries cease. We had read the reviews on this website (unfortunately not until after we had booked, rookie mistake), so we weren't really expecting as much as we had when we booked, but we were still left wondering where our money had gone to. Walking in to the room described as a "deluxe king suite" we felt we may have been given a lesser room like many others on this website seem to have experienced. The room was quite small, and the bathroom was insanely out dated featuring a shower over a high bath with a dismal shower curtain that couldn't even manage to keep the water in the shower no matter how it was positioned, rendering the bathroom floor very slippery. Our package included "Bathrobes, slippers and deluxe toiletries". We opened the cupboard to find bathrobes that neither of us would even cut up for rags if we had them at home. They felt like sand paper and looked ratty as anything, and clearly weren't new. The slippers were brand new, but there was only one pair for two people. We opened the kettle to make some coffee and quickly decided we'd rather spend the money on some Starbucks. The inside of the white kettle was pitch black and smelt quite odd. Upon opening the bar fridge we found that something had been spilled in the bottom and not cleaned up. We weren't even supplied with a toaster. First impressions were not good. After exploring for the rest of the day and crashing out quite quickly after returning to our room that night, we woke up, showered, and went to explore some more. Upon returning before going to find some lunch we discovered neither of our door cards worked and we needed to return back to reception to have them reset before being able to access our room. We noticed the room had been serviced. Naturally we were happy about this, until I walked in to the bathroom to notice that we had absolutely no towels. They had taken the ones we used that morning and not left us more. We both thought that this would be room service 101. Room service was insanely pricey, you couldn't order something simple like toast, cereal or spaghetti on toast for breakfast and the cheapest option was a single slice of banana bread at $4.50 a slice. Again, its worth the walk to the nearest Gloria Jeans or Starbucks to get a tastey bagel or muffin with a nice waking coffee. There was no way we were paying $30 each for a dismal looking buffet breakfast when Pancakes on the rocks was a short walk and half the price for the best pancakes you've ever eaten. All in all, for what was supposed to be an experience that was something out of the ordinary, an escape from the mundane life of home, the hotel experience was quite average, and far from "deluxe". I would not stay here again, and I would not recommend my friends to stay here either. I suggest you look around before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stopover for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and this is an ideal location to visit Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the CBD. It is a quiet location, even with the Sydney Entertainment Centre next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable enough”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Rockford is a great location if you want to shop at Paddys Markets and Harbourside. Also the monorail station is a short walk and it will transport you to the city for shopping. The staff were friendly and happy to help. The rooms are okay but housekeeping usually forgot something when cleaning the room each morning. The reception area needs to be organised better as when there is a large number checking in and out its a rabble to see who gets served first.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmany88
Reviews.Content: Novotel Rockford is very conveniently located. It is just 5 minutes walk to the Darling Harbour ferry. 1 minute walk to the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Very close to Chinatown and restaurants. Monorail is very closed. A lot of attractions nearby e.g. Sydney Wildlife World. Acquarium, Powerhouse museum. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room is not very big but good enough with flat tv and kid's channel which our kids loved a lot. There are 2 computer which you can go online free for 20 minutes. The pool is not big but good enough for our family to have a fun time. I will definitely stay at Novotel Rockford next time.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour Dec 2010 Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel regularly due to value for money, standard and location. Also, we enjoy eating at the Pumphouse.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel close to everything at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Rockford represents excellent value for its location at Darling Harbour. Everything is within easy walking distance but parking is also close by & reasonable at $25 per day. Rooms were a reasonable size & well furnished for the price. A request for additional pillows was seen to immediately & front desk staff were friendly & efficient. Our only complaint was at breakfast, the coffee machines were very slow & needed constant attention from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Gerat Stay”
Reviews.Author: Juliaone Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff were friendly and helpful especially with young children, rooms were basic but great value for money. Pool was a little average. Food was excellent at the Pump restaurant and great value with accor card. It is in a great location perfect for sight seeing. 24hr movie deal a real bonus for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a great success, thanks in part to the quality of this hotel. The location was superb for our needs and enabled us to travel around with minimal fuss. All amenities great and we used the pool and gym also. Great value, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Rockford”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little too far away from Darling Harbour to be titled "in Darling Harbour". I had to change rooms because the first one was right on the road and too noisy however they happily moved me and the next room was nice. The kettle was full of slime and I had to ask three people for a new one however once again it was done with a minimum of fuss. Overall it was value for money in Sydney but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and position, though the mattress was slightly torturous. Don't bother upgrading to the executive room for the club lounge as it consisted of a unserviced automatic coffee machine and internet access. A far cry from the expected facilities. The buffet breakfast at $30.00 pp was also very disappointing, Particularly for time of year, mostly canned fruit, cold hard eggs, pancake machine not working, and while I went straight in some were left waiting in the lounge for tables.

Reviews.Title: “Rockford”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay. Close to Darling Harbour and city.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to city and Darlingharbour attractions. Public transport easy to find and use. Friendly and helpful staff to assist with any enquires about the best way to get around. Only one little hickup with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford in Sydney's Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour and found it to be an excellent hotel, very well located to amenities and transport, very clean, very quiet, very good service. Next time I'm in Sydney .I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Darling Harbour stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was lovely. The staff on check in were very friendly and accommodating I even got an early check in (arrived at 8am) the room was comfortable a few more channels eg. digital channels on the tv would have been nice - very limited. Downside - When I checked out at 3am the staff member wasn't very welcoming or helpful with regards to travelling in the city at that hour, not very friendly either :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & comfortable - great location for us.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a really short trip to sydney for U2 concert, great location with walking distance to central station for trains to ANZ stadium. Rooms comfortable & very clean. Sam on reception very helpful on check-in. 2 bad points: 1) breakfast was horrible ($30 for a full breakfast) - service was bad - we got ignored upon arrival & breakfast was cold & not very tasty. Should have walked to McDonalds (5 mins away!) and got a cheaper & nicer breakkie. 2) Included in our rate was the club lounge. Went to use the internet to print boarding passes & had lots of trouble with the printer (settings weren't correct on printer - admin rights didn't allow us to change it). We wasted almost 1 hr. Somebody came up to help but didn't really know how to fix. Ended up with no boarding passes for check-in. Somebody needs to check the setup of all the computers. they were also pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfasts, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AnnandBrian
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our week-long stay in Sydney because it was significantly less expensive than the larger Novotel on Darling Harbour, and we are glad we did. The location is perfect: minutes from Chinatown, Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour and next door to the famous Pumphouse restaurant (with special deals). Make sure you book the B&B rate, as otherwise you will pay more for the very good buffet breakfast. Staff were a little more withdrawn and less cheery than other places we have stayed, but were helpful when asked.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerSara
Reviews.Content: My husband is a little not feeling well after long hours of travel, when we arrived in the hotel we need to wait a while for the room to be ready, finally when we can have some rest, while we were taking a nap the room service keep on knocking the door and finally trying to open the door from outside with master key, and found out that they were trying to access the wrong room number. besides that we were quite satisfied with the hotel. although the room is a bit small, but the location of this hotel is very nice, i can take a short walk to the harbour and enjoy scenic garden along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Better than YMCA just”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Did not appeal at all. Coffee machine horrendously bad as was breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Rockford”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was fine, the view over Darling Harbour was beautiful. The room was clean and had all the things you would expect, but is was very small and the bed wasn't very comfortable. Wasn't overly impressed with the breakfast selection or the staff, the weren't very friendly. Would stay there again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic for a over night stay good I wouldn't stay with small children and check out could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Novetel Rockford Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient location Close to Parking, entertainment and transport. We have stayed previously as well as recently and have no complaints regarding staff, service, food. Check in and checkout prompt and staff friendly. Thank you to all concerned for making our stay a pleasant experience. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great central location to Sydney city and Circular Quay, Darling Harbour. Due to our late nights getting back from the train station was also no hassel. Food was good at both Breakfast and Dinner at night, if you did decide not to dine there were plenty of alternatives near by. As we were only there for a short stay it was all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “we went to the Eagles concert at the entertainment centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All staff we encountered we very pleasent and helpful we had a special request with a room and they accomadated us with our request.We really liked our room it was very central to everything we wanted to do in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “worst Novotel ive stayed at...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: TV Remote in room didnt work, plug in sink in bathroom didnt work.. Breakfast arrived 9.50am in cafe.. closed at 10.30 for breakfast, but began moving food away at 10.15, had to grab everything we needed. Coffee machine didnt work properly, out of action each day. I thought your 'Do Not Disturb' door sign would say 'Please service Room' on the other side, no..look carefully.. I didnt and missed the room servicing. Got back to hotel after 4, was told they had finished for the day, so I asked for some towels.. This also meant no replenishment of coffee/tea, toiletries etc. Definately not a 4 star hotel, was left very disappointed. Wouldnt go back again...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place to Stay. Never Returning!”
Reviews.Author: Ahhuat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 13-16 Dec 2010. The room was horrible. We stayed at the Holiday Inn which is just across the road from Novotel Rockford in 2008 and the price wasnt much of a difference. We wanted to try something different for a change. What a mistake! The bed was lumpy and creaked so loud that it woke me up every night... repeatedly! The room was cramped and it looked just... tired. There were finger prints on the walls, much of which was dirty. The toilet looked run down and even the handles on the cupboards and the drawers were worn. Breakfast was horrid, leaving us to choose the free instant coffee in our rooms over the sour excuse for coffee that we had at the dining area. Breakfast was the same every day with no variation. The staff seemed albeit daft at times, but soon I learnt that they just didnt care much. I asked for a salt shaker and a waiter went back to fill one up, and conveniently forgot about it. Sat at the same table the next day and there was still no salt shaker! 24 hours to get one salt shaker?! The eggs were dry and when refilling the serving trays at the buffet, the chef was not bothered about spilling the baked beans onto the grilled tomatoes. Never returning not recommended. If you're gonna waste your money there, you might as well get everything right at the Holiday Inn right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “not a good weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: bed was so uncomfortable tried to sleep other end but no better like sleeping on a bean bag. Also parking two family members cars were broken into and many other cars were broken into in the same car park that night that they tell us to park in .

Reviews.Title: “Great location for concerts at Sydney Entertainment Centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were good, great location and service was good. Only complaint was the area for breakfast needs to be bigger. The hotel was very full and large groups for breakfast were being told to wait 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a concert”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights to attend an Eagles concert and spent the next day going to Manly on the ferry so it was very convenient. The room was clean and very comfortable. The only criticism was breakfast. We had to wait 15-20 minutes to get a table and then the quality of the cooked food from the buffet was disapointing. The second morning we skipped breakfast. Would stay again but probably not include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Rockford is a fantastic place to stay if you want to be near everything in Sydney. So close to all the great sights- walking distance or quick bus or train ride to everything in the CBD, Rocks and Darling Harbour. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Rockford Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the hotel was clean and comfortable and staff were very friendly and helpful. Some of the other guests were inconsiderate in that they were opening and closing their doors around 5.10am on both mornings so much so that my husband had to get up and ask them to keep the noise down. The doors are difficult to close quietly but guests should consider their neighbours!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marcothepolopony
Reviews.Content: This is a good base for concert goers and shoppers alike. My room was quiet and fairly comfortable. I had difficulty showering as the deep bath made exiting the shower very painful for this partially disabled patron! New modern bathrooms, nicely decorated however. Bed and pillows were awful. Hard and uncomfortable. Radio and standard lamp did not work. Breakfast included in the price, was highly sought after and I was unable to be seated till 10:30am. Basic but hot and freshly prepared, even at that time. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford - great location”
Reviews.Author: JennyKiah Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as we were going to a show at the Entertainment Centre. It was ideally located across the road. Only problem was that we could not get into the restaurant as it was already fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel spoilt by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at Rockford Darling Harbour to attend a concert at Entertainment Centre. Really convenient, rooms OK but service absolutely dreadful. Incredibly rude man at the restaurant in the morning for breakfast, food awful, no coffee (machine kept breaking down) totally spoilt our stay. Recommend the Hotel but go somewhere else to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Rockford Novotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for attending the Eagles Concert because the venue was only 50 metres away. The Pumphouse Restaurant was very good and the Ceezons Cafe in the hotel where we had breakfast was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, comfy bed and lovely customer service”
Reviews.Author: janandt0m
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with the location of this hotel. It is really quiet, but just a short walk to Darling Harbour. The bed was really comfy and I slept really well. The service from the staff was fantastic ... friendly, helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was so quiet, and the bed so comfortable, I slept extremely well. The staff were lovely and provided great friendly service. I would definitely stay here again, for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in better hotels based on star rating and quality.... rooms a little confined and small, along with hallways, space, however overall we had a relaxing time... enough to revamp those batteries

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Nice Lil' Rooms, but they need an Overhaul of Front Desk Staff.”
Reviews.Author: SadatHassan
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews of this hotel before i stepped out of my home enroute to the airport, stayed there and i am even reading the reviews of the hotel before i get my reviews typed out. Here i am, wondering why is there such mix reviews with regards to the attitude of the staff. The stay was from 16th Nov - 20th Nov 2010. The hotel itself is like a surprise. Nice comfy room with excellent location. It is 5 minutes walk to Paddy's market and Chinatown. The roads are connected to major attracttions. But most of the front desk staff.... I have no complains about the housekeeping and the breakfast bistro staff as they are approachable and warm. A colleague of mine left a camera at the boot compartment of a cab when she stowed her stroller for her kid and shopping bags together with it. We approached the front desk for help and the only person who was truly helpful at the Front Desk was a guy called Ken. He did everything he could including checking the CCTV for the taxi number but was unsuccesful due to the resolution of the equipment. He called the cab company to report the loss and was updating us on the situation every now and then. It was a totally different story when he was off duty. I had one incident whereby within 5 minutes, 2 of us went asking about the situation update and was told 2 totally different answers, and when both of us appeared together, the staff just smirked and walked away to avoid the situation. There are another 2 incidents with the front desk staff which explaining will take at least another page, which I do not think is necessary having outlined the point. Or maybe the whole group consisting of 35 of us are just a sensitive lot.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay my daughter and grandaughter were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel .The staff were friendly the breakfast was great and it was so nice to have such a lovely view of the gardens from our window .We have already decided to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HolidayForUs
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Floor 5 during November 2010 for four nights. The hotel is quiet considering its location to the centre of Sydney and the room is spacious. The only facility that seemed to be missing was a safety deposit box. The hotel offered WiFi but they were charging $15 for thirty minutes: there are several fast food shops nearby that offer free WiFi, which worked well. The room has a minibar fridge that we used to store some food for breakfast: we didnâ€™t try the hotelâ€™s breakfast or the hotelâ€™s restaurant. The hotel has a small gym and a pool, which seemed well equipped. Check-in time is 2pm and check-out time is 11am, so if you arrive at 10am (like us) be prepared for a bit of sightseeing before settling into your room. The hotel is ideally placed for Darling Harbour, which is only a five minute walk away (donâ€™t miss the fireworks display at 9pm on Saturday evenings). Thereâ€™s a tourist information centre in the Harbour area, which is worth a visit. From the Harbour, many of the main tourist attractions are within a half-hour walk. The lively China Town is also near to the hotel. Just down the road is Paddyâ€™s Market which is ideal for shopping as it is cheaper than many of the shops in Sydney centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, polite, friendly staff. Fantastic location. Loved the valet parking! Would stay there again, Thank you

Reviews.Title: “my weekend away to Robin Williams”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel because we were going to see a show at the entertainemnt centre, proximity to the ent centre was gr8, we could see the door we had to go into from our hotel room so u couldnt ask for anything closer. The breakfast was value for money I would recomened paying for the bed and breakfast deal gr8 value for money. We enjoyed our stay and the staff couldnt do enough for us they were very plesant and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: AllanLoganCity Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff attitudes on checking in were not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean. Beds very comfortable. Great location, close to transport and other points of interest. Staff polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this Hotel and will use it again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing, never again”
Reviews.Author: busymother_7
Reviews.Content: I had booked directly through Accor a King Superior Room for 2 nights. Upon arrival at the hotel, my husband dropped me out the front with our luggage while he went to park the car. I was struggling with the luggage (2 bags, laptop case and backpack) and not once did any of the staff offer to help or bring out a trolley. I managed to load my luggage by myself on a trolley right in front of the check-in desk while the staff looked on! I checked in, went up to our room, only to discover it was not a King Superior room, but a tiny room with a double bed. I went back down to reception to say there has been a mistake, only to be told "sorry we have not got any King Superior rooms left"!!! By this stage my husband had arrived and basically said that we have booked a King Room, if you cannot give it to us we will stay elsewhere at Novotel's expense.
