The Manager was then called and after about waiting 10 minutes they upgraded us to a 'Deluxe Room' at no extra cost which had a King size bed. I am not sure what the difference is between a Deluxe room and a King Superior but I imagine not alot. The Deluxe Room was comfortable enough, it had a view over the Chinese Gardens and the bathroom was OK. When going to bed that night however, it was discovered that the sheets had a few small holes in them. I couldn't believe it! So in summary, I will not be staying there again - the staff were unhelpful and the whole Novotel experience was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple but nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Rockford is in an excellent location. My twin room was suitable for myself travelling but was a little small. Everything was clean and tidy. Thoroughly enjoyed it for a quick stay. If I was staying longer I would probably like a bit bigger room. All good otherwise as close to monorail, tram & china town and darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “ready for some refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a king size bed but reception informed me that only 2 singe beds was available. I'm flexible so I said as long as there are sheets on my bed. I got in my room and ... no sheets on the bed. So I had to drag my luggage back to the reception for a another room. The room is rather outdated. Impossible to have a quit drink or a coffee in the hotel bar. Only in the bar next door which was more a public disco. Perhaps only that evening but I didn't want to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to all Darling Harbour attractions.”
Reviews.Author: NilesPortMacquarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and couldn't have been happier. Nice room overlooking Chinese Gardens & Ferris Wheel. Excellent buffet breakfast included. Fluffy bath robes & slippers supplied. Close to China Town, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour & Entertainment Centre. Only fault - reception staff a little surly.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay in Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Philskellygang Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was convenient, however the service was very average. There was a tour group in and no hot food was available at breakfast for a long time, as the hotel did not cope with the number of guests. The room was clean however not very large and there is no parking at the hotel, you have to park in the entertainment centre car park at a cost of $25 for up to 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to other travellers purely for the location. The beds were very comfortable and had a nice layout. Our toilet didn't flush, every third flush seemed to work which wasn't ideal. Reception was advised of this on our first day and we heard nothing. We had to ask for milk as none was left in the room on day 2. As I said purely for the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was lengthy - people we were with got through straight away. Room service - person did not wait until we answered the door, just barged in. Asked for fresh milk and got long life milk again. Staff wanted to clean/attend to our room whilst we were still in it - they did not want to wait until we had gone out. Some staff seemed to have a problem understanding English. Location was good, close to Chinatown and Paddy's Market. Rooms and Hotel were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved how close to the Entertainment centre the resort is ( we went to Robin Gibb concert ). Convenient walking distance to Cockle Bay and all restaurants etc. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in needs work”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: OK but check-in was poor. Arrived before room was available so went for a walk and asked for a text to let me know when the room was ready - didn't happen. And then when we got to the room they lost a bag. I rang reception twice to get them to bring it up. In the end I went down myself and got it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pratt109 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We went to a Robin Gibb show at the Sydney Enternainment Centre and stayed at hotel. It was very convenient location, close to Darling Harbour Restaurants and provided good room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to Darling Harbour & Entertainment Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingstie1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great value for money and it's located in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great city location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked online, not really knowing what to expect except that the hotel would be to a high standard being a Novotel. It was a bit hard to find, but that said, everything else was really good, so close to the action of Darling Harbour and the wonderful restaurants of China Town. Four of us had dinner at the "Pump House" (hotel restaurant) - a bit disappointing food-wise for two of us - but that may have been our choice as the others were very happy. Room was somewhat small but nicely appointed and the king size bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Rockmans at Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I didn't find the inital reception staff to be that helpful. they were not aware of advertised promtions. We phoned for a different selection of pillows and never received the pillows. The staff in the restaraunt/hotel attached to the hotel were great.

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: was pretty confusing to find the front door than there was no parking and i had to pay and walk 200m in the rain with my family back to the hotel and everyday the breaky was fry.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked The Chinese Gardens and Darling Harbour - a lovely view. Hotel was ideally located to the business function my partner needed to attend. The room service meal I ordered was excellent. Friendly staff at check-in and check-out. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Rockford”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend Novotel Rockford - excellent location, good stay, excellent breakfast and superb food and service at Pumphouse.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the service and the hotel very good. Access to the town easy and close to monorail. The staff at reception happy and appeared pleased to see you. Room very comfortable and the view over the Chinese Garden beautiful. The only negative thing we have to say is the entrance to the hotel very small and cluttered with taxis etc and not so good unloading suitcases from car in the rain & having to park the car in a public car park away from the hotel. Also, the executive lounge was really a non event and the coffee machine did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Superb !!”
Reviews.Author: PublixFlorida Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 months traveling in Australia & New Zealand, this was our last night before flying home. Everything was GREAT, starting with check in ( we were early, no problem ), our room was clean & quiet, well set up. Our view from the 7th floor was into the China Gardens across the street ( beautiful ). The location was perfect for shopping, entertainment & restaurants located at the harbour & George St. Did I mention easy friendly service with an oustanding buffet breakfast ??? Would we stay again?? YES< YES< YES

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good amenities, wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Jassym
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in July because I had to attend a conference at the nearby Sydney Convention Centre. The hotel was well located, near to the convention centre (the harbour - Cockle Bay) and Chinatown. It was also a few minutes walk to the train station (not one but two) where you could take the train into the shopping district. Food wise, it's close to 2 McDonalds but the hotel restaurant, the Pump Room, is really where you want to be. I recommend the amazing mussel risotto. I booked my room through accorhotel.com. Being an Advantage Plus member, I got to claim my free night and also got 1/2 price off the food at the Pump Room (excluding alcohol). I got a room on the top floor with am amazing view overlooking the chinese friendship garden. The room had a king sized bed and internet was complimentary. The hotel also had a tiny gym and a heated pool. I loved my stay there and would definitely stay there again. A few of my colleagues booked the other novotel hotel, and they all regretted it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Central train station (10 min) Paddy's Markets, Darling Harbour, Powerhouse Museum and Sydney Entertainment Centre. Attended an event at the Olympic Stadium and made use of the great free train to and from the event. Breakfast buffet reasonable but nothng flash.

Reviews.Title: “All good/average except for the room service Nachos”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Nachos ordered from, and very reluctantly supplied by, room service were simply appalling. We repeatedly tried to sign up to the loyalty program but their web site form is faulty and we gave up (their loss).

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very noisy at night with traffic. The rooms are also a little small. For the price and that it is 4 stars in the middle of city a decent hotel. Printing off their internet for a airline ticket was a hassle - I actually could not do it in the end. Not bad overall for the price and place to sleep for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Albinoosh
Reviews.Content: Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour's location is perfect, 20mn from the airport via the new tunnel, walking distance from SCEC, Darling Harbour restaurants, bars, Paddy's market and Chinatown. Great rooms as spacious, clean and comfortable. Great showers and powerful hairdryer!! Very important when you are a female traveller who can't be late to her meeting! Pumphouse is a great place to relax after a day's work with extremely friendly and smiling staff, great selection of drinks and good atmosphere all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney, excellent location fo all your visiting needs.”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and was impressed with the standards that the Novotel offers to its customers. Nothing was a problem for the staff and any difficulties were addressed immediately and with great efficiency. This is the kind of service that I have come to recognise as lacking with many so called 'higher class' hotels. Combine this with the comfortable rooms and good facilities the hotel has for its customers and I am extrememly confident to endorse this establishment to fellow travellers. My criticisms if I have to highlight any were breakfast could have been better and the internet didn't work on any of the five evenings that I actually tried to use it. (I reckon this is not really the fault of the hotel but it affected my stay there all the same). Enjoy Chris.

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: rochh Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly & very accommodating staff from the beginning. Had brilliant room but difficulty with locking a 'door' onto a balcony. This door not suppose to be open but left open unintentionally by cleaners. Shame, due to out of hours staff unable to lock/secure safely so relocated. Room relocated to not as good re size, bathroom, or view. But staff brilliant. Great position near Paddy's market & all the harbour area had to offer. Ability to walk or all sorts of transport options. Right near China town. Breakfast options/staff very friendly & food good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fab breakfasts - terrible bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsBetty66
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel and must say overall it was a great experience. The hotel staff were lovely, really friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable, with a great hot shower, fab breakfasts (inc in price), brilliant location and good room service. However the bed was terrible! We had booked a king size but it was no more than a double at best, the mattress was soft and lumpy, also it 'dipped' in the middle so we were pretty cozy! Should have complained but got the room for a great price, the breakfast was exceptional and everything else was fine so decided not to. Would stay again but next time will change rooms if the problem reoccurs as my back is still aching!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurawollongongNSW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, close to everything in the city. We found a great B&B rate on accor website and found it real value for money and were even upgraded to club rooms which were fabulous. The staff were very helpful, rooms spotless and look forward to staying again on our next trip tp Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Taleteller91 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at this hotel. Teenage daughters at concert at Enternainment Centre, so a perfect excuse to stay again. Staff always friendly, rooms clean and decent size. We always manage a swim in the heated pool before we leave. (If you ask for fresh towels, they're usually straight from the dryer.) We'll definitely be back. Beautiful meal in adjoining Pumphouse restaurant. Best waitress we've ever experienced - Thanks Gabriella.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: dejadan
Reviews.Content: Located next to Chinatown and a short 5min walk to the Harbor it is centrally located. Room was small. No balcony or windows that open it felt very cramped. The hotel staff was courteous but mostly uninformed with the exception of Samm who when he was on duty gave us good info. Late checkout was $20 an hour after one hour which I thought was steep.Breakfast was typical Aussie and expensive .The Pumphouse pub that is their restaurant was poorly run and food was not very good. 20 tables open for lunch and we had to eat in the bar on stools(tapas,not good) The bed was the worst bed we have slept on in a long while. Old and lumpy. There is another Novotel right in Darling Harbor that has better views is better located and looks newer,that I would say is a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly ordinary”
Reviews.Author: hbotis
Reviews.Content: It's not awful, but everything is exceedingly ordinary. Room is tired, bathroom is under-equipped. If you can afford more, go elsewhere. Good location that's all. Needs major overhaul-- staff is ok by Australian standard. There was a high cockroach on the wall in the lobby one night....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bimo2700mf
Reviews.Content: Im travelling with my friends, the hotel is nice, it has modern design and clean enough, the room is cozy, the bathroom are clean, i can sleep well because the room is quiet and comfortable, the plus point is because the location is near from harbour and if you need anything you just can walk outside hotel, because there are many shops near the place

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, but room tired and cluttered”
Reviews.Author: JamieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a third floor room overlooking the forecourt of the Sydney Entertainment Centre. Very handy location - Paddys Market, Chinatown and Darling Harbour's attractions are all within easy reach - no need for a car! From other reviews I've read, there are some wonderful rooms in this hotel, however I chose the cheapest I could find, which probably negatively affects this review. So keep this in mind when deciding whether to stay here. Despite being very clean, the room I had seemed a bit tired looking. It had an old CRT TV, and one of the lining boards behind the TV was very loose. The toilet had a very old fashioned lever to operate the flush which took a bit of getting used to. However, the biggest complaint I had about the room was that there wasn't much space. While the room was probably a bit small, this was made worse by the fact that every ledge, bench, drawer or anything you could possibly store something on or in was full of snacks and drinks at the usual expensive mini-bar prices. I would have loved to stack my maps, guide books, etc, beside the TV - no can do, there was this imposing stand of brochures of other hotels in the same chain occupying what was the only decent bench space available. I bought a 2 litre bottle of orange juice from the supermarket to stick in the bar fridge - what an ordeal getting that in! The bar fridge was overloaded to bursting point with every imaginable beverage. For some people, that's great and they get variety, but for me, it was a nuisance as I don't use the mini bar so I had to unpack half the fridge, remove things and then rearrange everything just to squeeze a bottle in. Other than that, the staff were very helpful and efficient and the place was spotless. Advice to potential guests - choose one of the better rooms and you'll have a very pleasant stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: p0ppy1wirral
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location to visit Sydney and all its attractions. Its a 5 minute if that walk to Darling Harbour restaurants and round the corner from china town. There are river taxis or you can catch the ferry into Sydney Harbour. There hotel staff where very friendly and helpful with advice on getting about etc. The rooms where very clean and had all we needed. We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and wish it was longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and central”
Reviews.Author: roddersNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from staying at Novotel Rockford darling habour, it is so close to Darling harbour and the Convention centre. Only stayed 2 nights but really enjoyed the excellent service from the staff on the front desk thru to the staff in the kitchen. Breakfast in the morning is included in your price and has plenty of great food. I will be back - cheers from Room 326!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Golftraveller1984
Reviews.Content: What a great location - the number 1 spot to stay if you have business to do in darling harbour or the city. I was there exhibiting at a trade show in the convention centre - a short 2 min walk away. I needed to use the hotel's business centre and had a few issues in doing so but their staff were extremely helpful and got me out of a jam! The conceirge was espically helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Not good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiamHuang1
Reviews.Content: room toilet broke and also many mosquitoes in the room, we were not happy. however location is very good and gardensn seem very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHamnett
Reviews.Content: The Check-in was very helpful when we found the painters still finishing our nominated room. They reassigned us to level 8, and to our delight a much more superior room. The buffet breakfast is always a delight at Novotel, especially if you have an Accor Advantage card.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gibbypal
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel close to city and darling Harbour Nice big rooms , good restaurant Can not fault the staff or service

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Marnie72
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the twin beds. Bad move. Definitely would not have thought this is a 4 1/2 star hotel. 4 Star would be pushing it, considering the room we had. The room was small, old, and the beds were not comfortable at all, very old. I didn't even book the room from a cheap site - straight from Accor website. I think the hotel star rating should be reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: katharry
Reviews.Content: We booked a â€˜mystery dealâ€™ on Wotif.com. It wasnâ€™t super cheap â€“ a reasonable deal for one night in Sydney. We checked in early and they said our room was ready. I opened the door into the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. A queen bed and that was about the extent of the room (side unit with a TV and that was it). Bathroom contained a shower only. I went back to reception and said the room was missing all the features the ad had said the room contained (ie the King bed, bath etc) and they did change us to another room which had a king bed and bath (shower over bath). The bed was lumpy and concaved and I found the room to be very noisy â€“ although this was down to the guests in the next room who decided to run up and down the hallways all night. The coffee cups were dirty - dried coffee left over from the last guests. All in all I would not stay here again and find it hard to believe they have a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeansew
Reviews.Content: I'll give Novotel Rockford 5 shinning stars! The staff at the reception were nice and polite. I booked a family room package. Both rooms were very clean and neat. The location is fantastic. You need not require any transport at all. My children loved the hotel and its location and vehicle free! Good for family with kids as they can run around without worrying about oncoming vehicles. All in all, we love Novotel Rockford...... except for their soft pillows... VALUE FOR $$ DEFINITELY.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but unfriendly staff and poor service”
Reviews.Author: loadsofemus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in April 2010. Although the facilities were fine and the location excellent for most of Sydney's attractions, the quality of service from the staff was appalling. There were very few happy welcoming faces at reception or throughout the building, the staff appeared upset if we asked for any help or information (nothing was forthcoming). We were also overcharged on departure, despite having prepaid, and were not even offered an itemised copy of our bill to check. Breakfast was poor and expensive, wifi was available but at an exorbitant price. I would only stay here again if I knew Sydney well and did not require any service from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: kbraybrook
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Novotel for a quick getaway for eating and shopping. Great location for accessing Darling Harbour and the shops! The first night we spent was in room 337 - very noisy as on a main intersection and close to the pedestrian beepy thing that goes all night. However, in the morning when we spoke to the hotel they changed us to a room down the other end (605) which was much quieter and had fantastic views over the Chinese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice room with great views....friendly & helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: lynWollongong
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour for one night on a weekend getaway. Got the room at a super low $99 internet rate and was upgraded to a high floor with fantastic views over Darling Harbour & the Chinese Gardens. The location is superb, close to everything, lots to do around Darling Harbour & China Town. If you're new to Sydney, take the tram from Haymarket to the Fish Markets for lunch. This is an inexpensive way to have a relaxing seafood lunch sitting on the promenade overlooking the water. I would also suggest taking the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay, a cheap way to see Sydney Harbour. The Novotel Rockford rooms are well appointed and modern. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend taking advantage of the valet parking service. You can park yourself in the Entertainment Centre carpark for $25, or pay an extra $10 to have your car valet parked. Was worth it to have the car brought to us at the door. We had a pleasant stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a Novotel hotel”
Reviews.Author: NML_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Rockford with my daughter as we were seeing a show in Sydney and the hotel was centrally located. We checked in with no problems, the room was small with 2 king single beds. The bathroom had a cracked sink, grubby grout in the tiles and some cracked wall tiles. The beds were hard and uncomfortable with no bedspread only a covering sheet over the doona. The aircon was noisy as were the street sounds from outside even though we were on the fourth floor. The room was clean and in a wonderful location right in China Town just behind the Entertainment Centre. The desk staff were helpful when checking in and out as well as in obtaining a taxi. Checkout time was 11am but the cleaners were outside our door at 9.45am ready to clean the room. Not so great as it felt as if we were being rushed out. All in all an average experience in an expensive hotel and not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: patrickandjoeinoz
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the novotel rockford and it was by far the best, the entire experience was better, check in was done in a very professional way and the concierge (sam I believe) was outstanding, he made us feel so welcome. The hotel manager also was very helpful and extremly professional, we did not catch his name, all we know is he was foreign and all the rest of the staff were great. We usually stay at the novotel sydney but the rockford is usually cheaper and this time the difference was so much that we chose the rockford and we will be back. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jamescomm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Rockford for the first time last week end and I must admit I was really impressed. I have been an accor member for quite some time now and I have been in most accor properties in the city and this one is definitely one of the best. I arrived early on friday and was told that i could have my room straight away, was offered an upgrade for $20 and that was worth it, I got a very nice room with great views of the chinese gardens. I stayed for 2 days and everything was perfect. I didn't try the restaurant as the hotel is right next to cheap eateries in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: CaptFeathersword76
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Rockford is in a great spot handy to absolutely everywhere in Sydney City with the added bonus of being a short walk from the action of Darling Harbour. The accommodation is very pricey in relation to the quality, but I acknowledge that this is what you get when you are trying to stay in a major world city. Rooms were fairly clean, which is a big thing for me. There was a bit of dust here and there but the essentials (sheets, pillows, bathroom) were spotless and amongst the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: stuandmar
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the staff quality at this hotel, I was quite sceptical after reading some of the previous reviews but I must say I will be back. We came for a concert at the centre accross from the hotel and the location was perfect and the service we received was second to none, despite the hotel being extremely busy, the staff were on top of it at all times including the manager who was everywhere (he even was handing out muffins when we were queuing at breakfast) Great stay overall, decent rooms, good location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Quality and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: united91
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at hotels in Sydney with work commitments, but this time I decided to stay the weekend with my wife & 2 young children. Right from check- in, everything went so perfectly for us, the reception staff were so pleasant and friendly, room keys were ready straightaway. The room we got was on the 8th floor overlooking the darling harbour with great views. Also, the room was spacious enough for us to have a baby cot and room to spare. Breakfast in the morning was so well laid out with great hot & cold selections, the staff were well trained and had a warm smile. Me & my family thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definately recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying. Great location. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChazzieB
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews from others who have stayed at the Novotel Rockford, I started to regret booking 3 nights (April 16-19th 2010). The main reason I chose Novotel was because of it's Location, I love Chinatown. Surprisingly my family and I had no major disappointing experiences! All the staff we came across were very accommodating and we didn't hear any loud music from the famous Pumphouse Bar located right beside the Hotel, so sleep was perfect. Plasma TV in our room (level 3) was 'huge'. The only minor problem we had was that the blinds broke and couldn't be rolled back up but after spending the day out and about, it was fixed when we got back. Location is Perfect. We took on the Family 3 day unlimited Monorail/Light rail pass which was great. We used the Monorail to travel to the City Centre and QVB without wasting time. A Restaurant I recommend which is only across the road from Novotel Rockford is Wagaya (Japanese Restaurant). If you like Tempura prawns, sushi & just Japanese food in general, you will definitely like Wagaya. Service is awesome. You order through touch screen monitor and you can see the progress of your order. Just try it out. Overall experience at Novotel Rockford, I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: macadamialee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its location. Its location is great as it is in Darling Harbour with close proximity to the Chinatown and Central. The room however is not impressive at all. A mini old-fashioned tv, dark room, no safe, there is a blanket not folded properly in the cupboard (imagine its cleanliness). The pillows provided are cheap/old as the cotton in it doesn't shape like how a pillow supposed to be (the pillow is kind of round instead of rectangular). We went to the easter show and came back pretty late at the night we stayed. As my partner has got some meeting in the morning next day till noon, I decided to stay in the room and have a good sleep till he comes back. So we went to the reception and extended our check out time to 12 instead of 11am. Guess what I got the next day? Housekeeper knocking on my door, coming in and shutting the door after realizing someone is still in the room every 30 minutes since 8.30am till noon. I couldn't take it and told them while they came in at 9am that I am checking out at 12, they still keep knocking on my door every 30 mins since then. Worst still, at 11.30am, one came in n went out, and came in again with another housekeeper in a second, and I was really unhappy and told them that I am checking out at 12 again. They probably couldn't understand English or they didn't not receive training as how a four star hotel's service should be. Worst sleeping experience I have ever had in a hotel. Probably I will get to sleep better in a backpackers!

Reviews.Title: “Luggage broken into, no accommodation for loss”
Reviews.Author: expat55
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:30 am and the hotel offered to store our luggage until the 3:00pm checkin. Great! When we arrived back at hotel around 5:00pm our bags had been brought up to the room. I noticed that the zipper pull had been pryed off my luggage, still attached to the other zipper pull by the TSA lock. Couldn't blame the hotel directly since I didn't throughly inspect my luggage. However I did report it. If anything you would have expected that the front desk would have accommodated me in some way. Nothing! Afterwards (5 min later) I asked about using the internet in the lobby. The front desk person then gave me a $15 credit. Although you could consider this accommodation, I don't since the discussion was long over.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: perth_guy10
Reviews.Content: Good place overall, very friendly helpful staff and good amenities, great location, walking distance to everything in Sydney. Would recommend and come back. Good business hotel

Reviews.Title: “Basic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CClarke74
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great base to do some exploring of Sydney and only a 5 minute walk to the marina which has lots of bars and restaurants. The hotel itself was comfortable. The bed was big, the room itself very basic and minimalist but was fine for our 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody noisy, slack service”
Reviews.Author: Nonoise5
Reviews.Content: We made one request, a quiet room. They put us in a room at the end of the hotel, the room was pretty clean and comfortable except the jug was full of black mold with lumps coming out when you swirled water around in it..... and guess what, our bedroom wall was right next to a friggen niteclub. doof doof all night till 4.00am. Then when checking out and was asked if we enjoyed our stay I said no, however did not request a discount or anything. Then I paid for the carpark and had to come back twice because they didn't give me the right tickets. Then the true service attitude came out!!! Handy location and I guess you only get what you pay for but didn't expect it to include a live night club. Never again, rather pay more for somewhere quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Below average service.”
Reviews.Author: jasonvan73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Some travellers noted noise and difficulty sleeping but we had no issue with this. The staff was not overly friendly and we did not feel welcomed upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Empty shell.”
Reviews.Author: DidierMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Finally got to the front desk, (understaffed) only to be informed by charmless man at reception that my booking was not coming up on their system, even though it had been paid for (on their own (Accor) website. Further, he said the hotel was booked out, no room at the inn. I told him he had a problem, not me and that i would wait. Where do i take you dear reader from there... well I had my reservation number but trying to save trees, i did not print out my entire booking form. He told me to do so but would not offer me his computer from which I could have accessed the booking confirmation letter. Instead he gave me a key to a 'corporate business centre' ( read room with some old computers and malfunctioning printers). Fortunately I'm a bit of a geek and managed to get some life out of the old girls. i trotted back down with my booking confirmation and... look its hardly worth the effort to tell the story. One and a half hours later I got a room, but the bed sheets did not look fresh. i rang the manager and was told it was hotel policy that sheets are not pressed, in accordance with their 'green policy' and that a card in the bathroom explained this ( it did not). Everyone i met a this hotel had their own stories of dissatisfaction, all seemed frustrated by the shoddy service. This is a tired hotel suffering from woefully poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: bensgirlSydney
Reviews.Content: We booked the Novotel Rockford for one night in January. It was my Birthday and we were having a party at Bungalow 8 at King Street Wharf and wanted to stay in Darling Harbour. We chose this Novotel specifically for the view of the Chinese Gardens where my Husband and I got married nearly one year ago, but it was the only reason it was chosen. I should have chosen another hotel. For the price it was a great deal. The hotel is quite small and only has eight levels, we were on level eight and had a fantastic view of the Chinese Gardens including another wedding which brought back a lot of memories. What I expected for the price was a clean room (one of the sheets had what looked like a blood stain on it as well as black hair in the sink so not as clean as we would have liked!), a comfortable bed (one of the worst beds I have ever slept on including some recent experiences with 3 star hotels in Europe, this bed was probably the worst we had ever experienced and the pillows were just terrible) and nice service (the woman who checked us in could not have been more disinterested in us if she tried. There was a fantastic girl who was checking in another couple, they were also staying because it was a birthday, we were not even asked why we were staying, no small talk, nothing. She had lovely chipped black nail polish as well and did not look like she had even bothered to brush her hair that morning!). The Hotel decor was quite bland, but modern. Good shower. The room was also really well soundproofed, good climate control in room and great dark curtains so you did not get woken up as soon as the run came up. We did not have time to see the pool or gym and had access to the Executive Lounge but had not time to go and use it. We ordered room service, terrible food. We would have been better off walking up to McDonalds or Chinatown to get a meal. All in all a pretty average experience. The view of the Chinese Gardens made it better, but if you can't get a clean room, a comfortable bed and good service it really does not matter if you get a great view (to me anyway). There are plenty of excellent places to stay in Darling Harbour. I would suggest that you choose another venue unless you absolutely need to have a view of the Chinese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: millie2112
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights - Monday 26th Of Jan and Tuesday 27th of January. I have stayed at the Novotel in Hong Kong and Phuket so I was hoping this hotel would be good too. The room size was ok, and very clean. The beds were comfortable at first but during the night I found I had a bit of a back ache. The TV was old and the remote control was very difficult to work. But it was fine. The location was good for us as it was 2 blocks from George St and the free shuttle bus. It was also good because on Australia Day we were very close to the celebrations in Darling Harbour. This hotel is not up to the same level as that in Hong Kong and Phuket but it is an overall good choice. I suppose my only criticism is it lacks 'character' and is a bit 'soulless' If that makes sense. However, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, average facilities for business”
Reviews.Author: QldTraveller62
Reviews.Content: If it weren't down the good end of town for a great selection of Asian restaturants it wouldnt be on my list to revisit. Very basic overall, but mostly clean (though knowing my room attendant has long dark hair after finding them in my basin wasnt a bonus) but not great for the business traveller. There is no "cabled" broadband internet access in rooms as it has been replaced with wireless which was extremely variable in it's performance - with periods of simply no access at all. Fine if you are on holidays but not acceptable on business trips where you need to connect to work. The voucher with the wireless password shows it is a $30 charge to use - but the hotel gave them away for no cost - I can only guess after complaints about the wireless service they are not currently charging for it. The staff were fine so provided you arent on business it could be an ok clean hotel for holiday makers wanting to be in Chinatown

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ships3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location. Walking distance to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the city shops. Circular Quay and The Rocks is a bus trip away or if you wish to to what we did walk 15 minutes straight down George Street. The rooms however could be a bit bigger. My husband and I travelled with a 3 year old and they did provide a rollaway bed upon our request. Once the bed was in the room, it left hardly any room to move! A larger room would have been better. I wouldn't say it's worth the room rate as it isn't anything too fancy but it is liveable and clean. The view from our room was lovely of the Chinese Gardens and the Monorail. The staff could be a bit more friendly on the reception seeing as it is the first point of contact. Our luggage was extremely late arriving to our room as they said they were extremely busy. We checked in at 11am and our luggage didn't arrive untl 4pm! Overall, a lovely stay but not worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: 1hotam
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is in a great location in Sydney! We were within walking distance to all we wanted to see! The hotel had a welcoming reception area with a large seating area to relax. We had friendly staff to help us with a quick check-in and answered all our sightseeing questions. We had a room on the 7th floor with a view into the nearby street, which was kind of a bummer, but we were okay with it. Our room was comfortable, inviting, and roomy with a huge bed, TV, nightstands, desk, dressor, closet, and roomy bathroom. I especially appreciated the American-ized hair dryer... instead of those small travel sized ones. The shower needed a little more water pressure, though. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning (got a great value booking through their website) which included cappucinos and lattes, full english breakfast, plates made to order, croissants, muffins, pancakes, juices, fruits, and cereals. The breakfast area had views of the nearby Japanse gardens, too, which was nice to see. Used internet access (20 minutes free) but it was rather slow and one of the two machines was inoperable. We didn't use the fitness center nor the pool. The nearby monorail ran every 20 minutes, but we didn't use it. We walked everywhere because attractions were close to the hotel... Sydney Tower, Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay Wharf, Chinatown, Royal Botanical Gardens, and more. Very convenient to walk to the Wharf to catch a ferry to Manly, which we did on our last day. We'd stay here again. P.S. This hotel was hard to find because, like other Australian cities, Sydney lacked street signs (unlike in America) and was not to be confused with the nearby Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour. A city map is a MUST! Sydney is a mixing bowl of streets!

Reviews.Title: “Beware if Travelling by Car or with Children”
Reviews.Author: tez823
Reviews.Content: Even if you book for children, you may find they don't have a separate bed when you arrive and you will be charged extra for a rollaway that makes a "King Suite" VERY squishy and uncomfortable. Hotel is difficult to access by car (lots of 1 way streets) and carparking is at Entertainment Centre. Easy to get to but not so easy to navigate your way from carpark back to hotel. Meals in hotel restaurant not suitable for children but fortunately there are heaps of options at nearby Darling Harbour which is still quite a walk for little ones but at least there is heaps to keep them occupied on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but noisy if in the standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: baalamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on the accor super sale deal which was only about $90 night so an absolute bargain especially for sydney. The location is fantastic -monorail very close, walk to paddys markets, central station, darling harbour. Car parking fairly easy at the entertainment centre carpark next door. Rooms were ok, not huge but fine for a weekend stay. This hotel has standard and superior rooms -we were in the standard rooms which are on lower floors of the hotel and are very noisy especially on a weekend with lots of teenagers hanging around the entertainment centre, I would suggest paying a bit extra and going for the superior rooms which are a lot quieter. The service was efficient and professional, we didnt eat at the hotel as there are so many great places to eat around darling harbour. The pool is a nice indoor pool -not huge but has a great view of the skyline at night. All in all this is a good hotel but just make sure you upgrade to the superior rooms for a quieter nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Belvedere34
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just great with all the advantages of Darling Harbour as well as China Town for the best variety of food available. The service given by the office and restaurant staff was brilliant and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. It had one of the best quality toiletries I have found in an hotel and this was a bonus. The only down side was that housekeeping may need to be improved slightly but this was made up by other staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value and service. The bar at the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel and the Best service in Australia”
Reviews.Author: MonaVieDiamond
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. The service of the staff was incredible. The room was fantastic, exactly what a top hotel should be. The Staff treated me like a family member they hadn't seen for ages and nothing was a problem. A Hotel stay like this, is one you really remember. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “What Problems?”
Reviews.Author: kiwisteve1
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel through Accor, I then read the reviews. Looked like a big mistake. I phoned in advance and asked for a non-smoking floor, to be advised that the whole hotel is non-smoking. No problems with our room. Asked for a high room as was expecting lots of traffic noise (we were on level 7). Did not hear a thing. Was expecting the room to be dated and tiny. Not dated, not worn and no really small either. The ONLY fault was that the robes were a little thread bare. Room had a nice view and even managed to see the ship from the room!! Nice balcony. Staff were fast, friendly and our room was ready early (thank you). Did not use the restaurant as China Town so close and so different (for us). Over all, no problems at all, we will stay again. Thank you staff for a great stay, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “A real let down”
Reviews.Author: roseyfam
Reviews.Content: After choosing this hotel because of it's proximity to the exhibition hall at Darling Harbour and having stayed here previously and found it to be excellent, I was very dissappointed this time. The furniture in the room appeared much shabbier than my previous visit, and the furnishings were in need of an update. The room and bathroom are reasonably sized, but have a "tired" and slightly grotty appearance. I decided to order room service breakfast, as the restaurant breakfast was ridiculously priced at $25 for a continental. On the first day this was excellent (despite coffee being served in a cardboard takeaway cup). Unfortunately the second day the wrong order was delivered twice. The gym was tiny and had very limited equipment, all placed very close together. There was a very long wait to check out - my parking ticket was not validated properly, another trip back to reception after realising this as I tried to get my car out of the carpark, another long wait to get ticket validated, no apology.....I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “WIll Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: tangojo
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here, I had no problems the first time, and no realy problems this time either. The "general" rooms are rather small, so I always ask for their bigger room (costs more, but worth it in my opinion). I wasn't overly keen ont hebreakfast - thought it could be better, but all in all my stay was enjoyable and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to Entertainment Centre”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife94
Reviews.Content: Convenient accommodation in a new and comfortable hotel next door to the Entertainment centre at the south end of Darling Harbour. We stayed there after a recent P!nk concert.For the price it was exactly what we needed. Bathrooms were spacious. I believe they have a parking arrangement with a local carpark but best to check. Breakfast was basic. Would stay again if attending a concert at the Entrainment Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: blixxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night. Acorr hotel group had a promotion going, $79 A per night. Check in was quick. Room was clean and looked new. Nice bathroom. We used the indoor heated pool. Had dinner at the casino which is 5 minutes away with the tram. This is a good central location for many attractions including Chinatown. We had the breakfast buffet which was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Right next door to Entertainment Centre”
Reviews.Author: zoshi
Reviews.Content: Super location. Rooms are compact (by Australian standards - big for Europe!) Expected traffic and street noise but this wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Floor 7 and 8 stank of cigarettes + rude service”
Reviews.Author: dockerslund
Reviews.Content: I'm normally not the person who would bother about writing a review, especially not if it's a negative one. But I was pretty astonished about this hotel. The first day we arrived, we checked in and dropped our luggage off in our rooms. The room was supposed to be a great room, because of a Wotif deal. Anyway, the room was tiny. OK, not to worry. As long as it's clean, we've got a comfy bed, bathroom etc. Late at night, we returned to the hotel, and the 7th floor (where we stayed) stank of cigarettes. Still, it was late, so we decided that we would worry about it in the morning. The next morning I called the receptionist and told him about the smell and that we would like to be moved to another floor, if possible. The reply was rude. "Why didn't you ask about this yesterday?" 5 mins later another receptionist (who was much nicer) called and said that they indeed had arranged another room for us on the 8th floor. We moved upstairs and the room was bigger too, so we were happy. But a couple of days later...the floor started smelling of cigarettes! We told them about it, and fair enough - the smell had disappeared a later that evening when we returned to the hotel. The breakfast is average, to say the least. No cheese, no strawberry jam. The selection of bread was slightly boring and the bread was dry too. The English breakfast was good though. But we won't be staying at this hotel again, and the two main reasons are the cigarette smell and the incredible rude service from one of the staff members (he had a Spanish accent).

Reviews.Title: “As average as it gets”
Reviews.Author: sneezing7
Reviews.Content: Normally I don't mind waiting a couple of minutes to be served (check in), as long as I receive some sort of acknowledgement from the staff that they have seen me. Usually a "hello" or even just a smile is suficient. I understand phones are ringing, paperwork has to be done etc... After 10 minutes of questioning if the plane had actually crashed on the way there and was I now a ghost, I am suddenly greeted with a "Can I help you" As far as the room is concerned; It didn't bother me that the walls were wafer thin, and you can hear someone sneeze 6 floors up. What did bother me was that there was a used band aid / elastoplast in the room. Regardless, the next day I paid my bill, left & made the decision never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Plan on a Good Night's Rest”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld25
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the Novotel Rockford on a recent trip to Sydney. Having stayed at several Novotels and Accor properties in the past, I had a certain expectation, but was quickly let down. After waiting several minutes to check-in (which seemed to be the norm- there was a constant wait to speak with anyone at reception), I requested a room on a high floor to avoid street noise (the hotel is on a busy street with a lot of traffic). While I was put on a high floor, I didn't avoid the street noise in the least. I don't expect it to be silent when staying in a major city, but the room was so loud I checked to see if the window was open. I could hear car horns, emergency vehicles with sirens, and loud cars almost as though I was right on the street next to them. The monorail also runs right in front of the hotel which adds to the noise level. I rang reception to request a room change but was advised that I would have street noise no matter where in the hotel I was and I may as well save the energy of moving rooms. The sounds continued into the night to the point that I pulled out ear plugs to sleep and even then could hear it. The bed was quite possibly the most uncomfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. It was rock hard and so thin that I could feel (and hear!) the springs. It was very difficult to get comfortable and the uncomfortable bed on top of the street noise made a good night's rest almost impossible. I inquired at reception whether I could possibly get more padding or if there could be a solution to the problem (i.e. room change), but was simply told that there was nothing they could do. Other than those two things, the hotel was decent. The room was spotless and clean, though it could use some new furniture, as it looked a bit worn. The heating/cooling system was different and it was either too hot or too cold in the room, but it wasn't a major issue, as I had mild weather during my stay and didn't need to use it too much. I didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked pretty expensive. There was free internet on the iMac computers in the lobby bar. The service was lacking a bit- I always had to wait at reception and although they were very pleasant when I spoke with them, they were never overly helpful. I requested extra linens from housekeeping one night and it took them 40 minutes to deliver them. The room was small, though it was big enough for just myself traveling alone (it would be tight for a family). The bathroom was small, but again, was fine for just 1 person. The location is great- it's 2 blocks from Paddy's Markets, a nice 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour, and right in the middle of Chinatown. The nearest train stations are Central and Town Hall (it's right in the middle of both, though Central is probably a bit closer) and they are about a 10-15 minute walk, but there is a tram stop right outside Paddy's Markets which will take you right to Central. The taxi to the airport is about 25 minutes with mild traffic and costs about $30. All in all, it was an okay hotel, definitely a 3 star (a 4 if they improved their service and updated the rooms a bit). If you are a light sleeper or need a soft bed to sleep in, I would say find another hotel. I wouldn't choose to return to this hotel and it wouldn't be one that I would recommend to a friend, but it's also not one that I would say avoid at all costs. If you're not picky, stay here- the price is reasonable and it's a good location. But if you are a 4 star kind of person, spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: BensAdventures
Reviews.Content: We were planning to spend a week in this hotel in April with my team from work, however one I spent one night, made sure that when we returned we'd stay elsewhere. It wasn't that the hotel was horrible, but the rooms were tiny, the bathroom was even smaller and the restaurant offered one of the most bland and limited breakfast menus. So the real issue was value for money. If I was playing $150 per night or less, than this hotel is fine, but when we were going to be charged over $220 per night, there is simply no value. If you get a good value deal to stay here then you won't be too disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Was not as close to the Convention Centre as suggested”
Reviews.Author: Shmoozey
Reviews.Content: Front rooms extremely noisy due to traffic. Staff promised to move me during the day while I was away at conference, but 'forgot' and I had to force them to change me. Rooms small and in need of a good paint job. Furniture looking shabby and worn. Breakfasts not cheap at all. Contintental $24.00 !! I will not stay there again and have told conference organisers not to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJulie
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents excellent value, its convenient for Darling Harbour, chinese gardens and chinatown. Its a pleasant walk to the city centre and circular quay. The room was very comfortable, bed was excellent and we had great views of the chinese gardens. Unfortunately the air con unit was a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BonVouage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it had everything we needed. Good location, 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour, good service and nice room, with a big plasma tv. Big bathroom with hot water and very clean. What more can you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Colin330
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in February 09 and chose this hotel for itâ€™s convenient location and booked a non-cancellable pre-booked room on the Accor website for $179 and specified twin beds. Acceptable for a Saturday night in Sydney close to Darling Harbour. I arrived early (approx 10.50am) and was told, quite reasonably and one I anticipated, that my room was not yet ready. Not a problem for me as friends were already staying in the hotel and I had pre-arranged to leave our bags in their room anyway. I was however able to check-in, be allocated room 416, my credit card swiped (for any extras) and told all was completed and I could pick up my room entry cards later in the afternoon on my return, after informing the check-in clerk I would be leaving the hotel almost immediately for a function. I returned about 4pm and when I asked for my entry cards, the body language of the desk clerk as the delay in processing a simple request to find my room was all the evidence I needed that something had gone wrong. My inquiry as to the problem was met with stony silence. It was evident she didnâ€™t know what to do or say and I asked to see the Duty Manager. Without any explanation or apology I was eventually told the hotel was now full but an alternative room would be found. No problem I said, just so long as weâ€™ve got 2 separate beds in it. I was assured a room was available but housekeeping would need a few minutes to put another bed in it. I then had a further discussion about what kind of bed they planned to temporarily install in the room was answered with assurances it was a proper full size bed. I didnâ€™t believe him and a room inspection as they wheeled in a rollway bed proved he was lying. The room itself would have been okay had it been occupied by the one twin bed that was usually in it. As we were only staying one night it wasnâ€™t worth the hassle of agreeing to the managersâ€™ offer to let him find us alternative accommodation elsewhere so we accepted what weâ€™d been given on condition the hotel provided 2 complimentary full breakfasts. This was agreed to but I subsquently felt a little peeved by the chain of events and demanded (and got) 4 instead - to cover my friendsâ€™ brekky as well, if only because I felt no-one, other than the duty concierge who was nearby and became aware of my dilemna, bothered to either immediately own up to the problem, and having accepted there was one, failed to offer any kind of apology. Not impressed. The choice at breakfast was reasonable but even after taking account of my now less than favourable attitude toward the hotel, the best I can say about it was that it was only â€˜fairâ€™. Other reviewers have said this is not a 4 star hotel, more like a 3 star. Putting aside my personal saga and one that hopefully doesnâ€™t happen too often, Iâ€™d rate it lower than that. Next time I will pay a little more and stay elsewhere. But it is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KimOzPom
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel and would definitely go back. Was a bit dubious after reading other reviews but it was good, had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. They constantly refill the brekky if anything runs out, they change it a little daily. The food and beverage manager guy was always there watching over everything and dishing out instructions. Couldn't fault it. We were out and about all day, returning to the room to get ready in the evening and then out for dinner. Good location, near to China Town and safe too. Oh yes, we didn't ever receive the chocolates that were in with our deal and even after asking 2 or was it 3 times they still never materialised. Maybe any problems are with front desk? Seeme fine checking in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dian79
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the hotel in early December and found that the location is very central in walking distance to the Convenition Center the Chinese Gardens, Chinatown and the Harbour which was very nice at night. Other Major Attractions such as the Opera house and the City center was only about a 30 minute walk, or a 10 minute Taxi ride although the traffic can be quite hectic. The Hotel itself was clean and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful, I agree that the rooms are small by Australian Standards and we did not have a view, although considering the price and location, we found it to be good value for money. I did not have any issues with traffic noise as I could have expcted in that location with the proximity of the convention center. We did not really have so much time to spend at the Hotel as there is so much to see and do in Sydney we found ourselfs out a lot. I would difinatly return to this hotel and recomend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staff aren't great”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2078
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK, if not a bit shabby, which I had already read on this site after it was booked for me. The staff I came across don't speak much English and give confusing information. And they made another guest pay a $200 deposit to borrow a phone charger! They don't seem to trust their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: PineappleSkip
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on a business trip, selected for convenience to the venue. My experience wasn't as bad as some of the caustic reviews I saw before writing this. A reasonable place to stay in an interesting part of the city, but I'd avoid the breakfast if my experience is typical. Check in (10pm) was satisfactory, as was check out, although it was a pity I couldn't get anything in the bar or restaurant - even a coffee - when I arrived. Room was very small by Australian standards, I have seen similarly small rooms in Sydney, comparable to rooms I've stayed in in New York and Europe, but I've also seen plenty bigger rooms also. Anyway it was clean and the fittings were of good standard and condition. Had a reasonable sized bathroom. The fire escape plan of the hotel indicated that there were larger rooms in the corners of the floor I stayed in, but they weren't much larger. Hotel is located in a busy area with a lot of traffic (cnr Pier and Harbour Streets) but I didn't have any problems with noise. The room had a smallish window and ordinary view of Entertainment Centre (large indoor concert venue) over the road. On the other side would be better views over Darling Harbour. Location is good for tourists, right beside the Darling Harbour precinct adjacent to the Chinese Garden, Chinatown on the other side, Monorail station diagonally opposite and tram stop only about 200m away. This is a more convenient location to the south side of the city than other hotels in Pyrmont, although you get better views from the latter (and pay for the privelege) Breakfast was a disappointment. A queue at check in, which felt more like an airport experience than a restaurant one when the check in person seemed more interested in the computer than the diners. It was uncrowded - I'm not surprised - and I got a window with a nice view over the Chinese Garden across the road. Breakfast Buffet was a limited selection of predictable but lukewarm dishes, and it came at an excessive price. Needless to say I only ate breakfast once as you can get better and cheaper from any number of places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rubbish!!!”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a business trip. I don't have any complaints about the rooms / cleanliness etc (except for the alarm clock that didn't work), but the service was what really let this place down. Ordering breakfast is usually pretty straightforward at most hotels, but not this one: apparently a new menu had just been introduced but no one knew about it - seems all of the staff missed the briefing!! Room service breakfast was late every day, including HALF AN HOUR on the final day - unthinkable!! Breakfast was undercooked - one day I ordered french toast with fresh berries and maple syrup, but instead. I got soggy, undercooked yellow bread with a berry compote and honey - go figure!! Tried to speak with staff about my experiences but generally most weren't interested. You would just get transferred from one person to another until they hung up on you. Or they would say that the duty manager would call you back, but they never did. But the piece de resistance? The phone call from reception at 11.30pm, but they had the wrong room. Urgghhh!!! Don't stay here unless you get an amazingly cheap price so you can overlook the poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Stormeh
Reviews.Content: We used to always stay at this hotel when visiting Sydney because of its great location, friendly & helpful staff, luxurious rooms, and nice swimming pool. While the location and staff are still great and the pool can't be faulted I must say the rest of the hotel is looking rather tired and in need of a serious refurbishment. The rooms are not what most people would consider "4 star" quality, I would say closer to 3.. E.g. I don't think the beds have been replaced in years, furniture looking old, carpet stained, toilet not flushing properly, etc. In addition the hotel wouldn't honour their "spring special" rate for any of the various dates we wanted and also wanted to charge us $24 per person for breakfast. We walked round to the lovely Blackbird Cafe for a hearty brekkie instead. Oh and the Pumphouse restaurant is no longer open for lunch, just dinner. In summary, this hotel is in a great part of Sydney down by Darling Harbour with lovely staff but in truth you should avoid paying anywhere near the rack rate because there are better 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH MORE THANT $120 per night”
Reviews.Author: simonjynx
Reviews.Content: We booked the Club King Suite for $329. This included access to their "Club Lounge". Checking in was ok. The room is small with basic amenities. The view over the chinese gardens also looks straight out over the highway (which you can hear at night). The Club Lounge should actually be called a business centre. There is a couch, some chairs, access to the internet (which you have in your room anyway) and juice in the fridge. Club lounges that I have been to in other hotels have staff that keep it clean and refreshments stocked. They servve more than just apply or orange juice (soft drinks, coffee, tea, canapes and oher refreshments. We usually stay at the radisson when we stay in the city however thought we would try somewhere new. We will not be booking anywhere other than the radisson again. We could have saved $100 and also enjoyed a more spacious and luxurious room while actually enjoying a real club lounge. Im very dissapointed and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for general travel”
Reviews.Author: aussiechell
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is your standard 3-4 star Australian property. The hotel is located approx 200m back off the water at Darling Harbour. It is within walking distance from the monorail, train and Central station for buses to outer Sydney suburbs. We found the hotel easily used as a base to commute around Sydney travelling to outer suburbs for football matches and to the beach. The hotel is fairly basic in design, however very comfortable for a place to sleep and shower at the end of a busy touring day. We stayed on the second floor fairly close to the road, however I only remember hearing cars a couple of times during the night and I am usually a fairly light sleeper. The black out shades on the window were so good that we slept in for the first time in months! Although we didnt use them, the gym was fantastic and had a small heated lap pool alongside. Breakfast was disappointing, especially on the second day of our stay when the resturant was a bit busier. In reflection I would nnot have paid the buffet price, rather going down to one of the many resturants in the city to have a cheaper and possibly fresher breakfast. Staff members were helpful face to face, however did not assist us when we requested transport advice over the phone. This however did certainly not ruin our stay! Overall the hotel is a great place to use as an average priced base if you are going to be exploring Sydney! I would not necessarily stay if you were intending on being in the hotel room much as the view is very minimal

Reviews.Title: “OK for business - but not pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Misha J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early 2008 for a business trip to Sydney. I have stayed at many Novotels - and can only assume that the 'Rockford' label is the generic name of the branding. The hotel has all the requirements of a business hotel - is nice and clean and conveniently located in the heart of Sydney - though not (strangely for a business hotel) in the business district. This didn't bother me too much as I am a former Sydneysider anyway. The room was of a decent size - though the housekeeping left a lot to be desired. The all inclusive rates did not include car parking - so the astronomical fee for valet parking was a joke, especially considering they required 45 minutes to bring up your car!!! Being opposite the Sydney Entertainment Centre does not help the situation either - if you don't like hearing thousands of people carrying on outside your window all hours of the morning. I was (un)lucky enough to stay when the Centre was hosting an international boxing match - the two thugs in the ring were not the only ones looking out for someone to punch! On the plus side, the reception staff were extremely friendly and always smiling. This almost made up for the pricy and not very appealing buffet breakfast. I felt urged to eat and leave quickly - due to some convention being held at the hotel. Not my worst experience (by far) but not a truly memorable one either.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller25Worcester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a whirl wind tour of Australia, typical business hotel. Good rooms, spacious, with all the amenties you'd expect, good minibar, good bathroom, there's a black out blind in the room which is pretty cool to get over the jetlag. Great location, you can walk anywhere in the city from here, max distance is about 25minutes to the opera house, enjoyed the walking through the city, you see things you wouldn't see normally. Staff were mostly helpful, attentive and pleasant. I found concierge good who offered me the assistance I needed. Check-in staff were friendly upon arrival and in the restaurant adajcent to the hotel (the Pumphouse), nice surroundings, lack of atmosphere but nice meals. Would recommend to my friends, but maybe I would suggest the other Novotel on Darling Harbour as that looked a slightly better location. But I would go back to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “It's only been downhill to this point”
Reviews.Author: MrHobbs
Reviews.Content: I virtually lived at this hotel throughout 2003 one week on one week off. The things I liked about the hotel as a facility are pretty much the same. Itâ€™s small, itâ€™s not a tour bus drop zone and very close to all the key elements of what people (visiting) like the about the city of Sydney. So whatâ€™s happened since 2003 apart from a minor name change? What was a somewhat utilitarian feel has become cold, boring and devoid of any human warmth. From my memory of the Hotel the staff augmented its short falls, housekeeping was good and reception had friendly professional efficiency. I arrived for two nights stay in May, coming to reception at 1.30pm I was asked to wait, I sat in reception whilst they readied my room, at 3pm I approached the staff to find that the room had been completed 40 minutes earlier. Even though I was sitting 15 feet away, even my bags had been sent up, they did not inform me. Front desk staff was not exactly run off their feet in the time period so there was no excuse for the oversight. I maintain a personal view of the service industry within hotels in Sydney as being superficial, disingenuous, and almost pretentious. My recent experience in this hotel did not change my view. I walked up to the room passing a tray of food left outside the room next to mine. It was ready for pickup. On the tray was a half eaten pizza. The room itself I liked it appeared well presented and maintained this was in contrast to the corridor carpet, damaged decor and paint chipped door architraves. The room service I had later that night was on time and the quality was good. I left the room the next morning 8am, my room service food tray was still outside my door and I walked past the pizza tray still in situ from the previous afternoon Returning from work that day, about 5 pm I was surprised to see the familiar, now petrified pizza still sitting there. When I came back from dinner that night about 11pm it had finally been removed. On a bright note the â€œpump houseâ€� bar and restaurant at the back of the facility remains as a significant jewel in the facilities crown however do not be surprised, as a paying guest you are shut out of the hotel facilities in favour of â€œprivate functions.â€�

Reviews.Title: “WE WON'T BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: chan_86
Reviews.Content: I myself read reviews on the internet before i decided to give this hotel a go for a holiday i had planned for my anniversary with my partner.. I thought the price was right and the location seemed perfect. .... WELL! i hope that by reading my review you will do yourself a favour and choose somewhere else to stay. The staff at this hotel are the most unhelpful bunch of people i have ever encountered. This was our first trip to Sydney and when i enquired if they had any maps of the city avaliable in the foyer or for purchase i was met with a response of " you get them elsewhere" The room service/ house keeping was deplorable we went sight seeing one day and went back to the Hotel around 3pm for a rest to find our room still had not been serviced. I spoke to the concierge who assured me they would have someone do it for us if we would like to return in 45mins. We did this, went up to our room and suprise suprise still no house keeping. I was quite annoyed by now as it was almost 5 oclock. i returned to the concierge with complaint and he finally fixed the situation... 2 hours later. If you're looking for a quiet nights sleep... you wont get it at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour. All through the night we were woken up by the sound of doors slamming in the corridor as the room doors are quite heavy. In the mornings when house keeping were doing their rounds they were very noisy and i overheard two couples complaining. The location is good, within walking distance the Paddys Markets, Darling Harbour and the Monorail station. This is the only positive to this Hotel. Overall... very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: sandymc
Reviews.Content: got to the hotel before 11am and the room was ready, very helpful reception staff, room twin bedded and very comfortable and clean, we were booked in for three nights Friday and Sunday reasonably priced but I felt Saturday at double the price was extreme, apart from that the location was good although could be a lot of noise from outside, short walk to Darling Harbour and Paddys market where there is lots of eating places being on the edge of Chinatown. good place to stay but avoid Saturday nights because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cela_trams
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour hotel for 2 nights in March '08 in a Superior King room. We arrived early morning on Good Friday at the hotel, knowing that check-in was only at 11am. But the hotel had a vacant room at 8am & they allowed us to check into the room, without any extra charge. The room itself was very clean with a large bathroom / toilet, which was well maintained as well. House keeping was as expected & upto the mark. Checking out took us less than 2 minutes (matter of just handing the card keys in), since there were no other expenses to our bill. We had paid for the room in advance. We only had the room booked (no breakfast included). The best feature of this hotel is its location. Its in the heart of Darling Harbour, walking distance to the restaurants, cafes, Sydney aquarium, Paddy Market, China town & the Cockle Bay Wharf. There's no room that has a harbour view though (as told by the reception). The airport is abt a 20-min taxi ride, that costs arnd AUD 30. There are plenty of local stores, asian take-away restaurants & bottle shops closeby. The Queen Victoria building & other shopping precincts are a 15-min walk from the hotel. We paid AUD199 per night for a Superior King room (sleeps 2) and it was certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms, decent price”
Reviews.Author: DanLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan 08 for a few nights and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were decently priced (booked direct through the hotel website). Our room was larger than average (although not massive) and the bathroom clean and modern. Breakfast was included in the price, and was quite decent. The bed was very comfortable. The receptionists were very helpful. The only major problem was that the queue on check out was totally crazy. it went outside the front door! That said, all in all this is a great clean hotel, with a modern business feel to it. We felt it was in an ideal location for Darling Harbour, CBD and the central train station. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TAMember021620123
