Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with friends Xmas 2005. The location is absolutelyt fabulous - it's a short and lovely walk to Darling Harbour. The hotel was usual Novotel standards - nothing special, but clean, tidy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: treynolds37
Reviews.Content: I liked the Rockford for two major reasons. The staff was great and helped out even doing a rush job on cleaning a stained shirt. The second reason was being on the far end of the park from the harbor, very quiet and a nice walk to the harbor. The Pumphouse bar is connected to the end of the hotel, nice place for sure. The only downside was the internet access was a little expensive, something like $6.00 for 30 minutes. In the USA most hotels offer free internet access. Great acces to shops and Chinatown is just a few blocks away with some good markets, food etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a rewards night I was attending at the Star City Casino and loved the hotel. The only downside was the noise from the nightclub downstairs. I've stayed in a few places at Darling Harbour/Haymarket but this hotel was the nicest, the bed was huge, nice views over Chinatown Gardens, close to everything. You can walk to the markets and market city, chinatown, Darling harbour and everywhere! The light rail stop is right outside and you can walk to Central Station. Check-in was a breeze and i'd definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing Sydney sites”
Reviews.Author: likeasharkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I regularly stay in Sydney on weekends away, usually prefering to stay in five star hotels on the waterfront. However, given that this time we were going to spend more time out of the hotel than in it, we decided to try the Novotel Rockford. We were not disappointed. Although only what I would class a basic three and a half to four star hotel (when you are used to the luxury with all the mod cons), you can't beat it for the price offered. Fantastic, (in fact perfect), location. About a five minute walk to all the restaurants Darling Harbour has to offer, three minute walk to Chinatown and Market City and about ten minute walk to QVB, World Square and Pitt Street Mall for further shopping. Directly opposite Entertainment Centre if going to the basketball (infact the basketballers were staying in the same hotel!) or similar event and also directly opposite monorail station. Rooms were on the small and basic side, but fairly clean. Bathrooms were quite large given the room size, not complaining. Water pressure of shower was good. Had a room facing the Entertainment Centre and was a little wary that it might be noisy, but was actually much quieter than our own room at home so slept right through! Breakfast is the usual buffet fair offered by nearly every other hotel, but still very good, fresh and constantly restocked with fresh cooking. There are plenty of nice cafes in Darling Harbour catering for breakfast also. Staff were all good and polite, check in and out was quick and painless. Only problems I would say were very minor, but worth mentioning so that people are aware. The lifts were slow and fairly inadequate for the volume of people who were staying in the hotel. Very noisy doors to hotel rooms when being opened and closed in the wee small hours of the night or morning, so be aware you may be awoken by this, but this happens in a lot of hotels! Parking is not directly adjacent or underneath hotel, which means you have to drive to the hotel, unload luggage, then drive to the parking and walk back, but easy to navigate too and not a far walk at all. Would definantly recommend this hotel to any travelers who are in Sydney to see the sights and not the inside of a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: wnethercott
Reviews.Content: The name may have changed but the quality of the stay remained . An excellent location being walking distance to Darling Harbour shopping and attractions, Chinatown and the market. Also by the convention centre and a red bus stop. The rooms are clean, quiet and the service is great. Breakfast is a little on the pricy side, but there are lots of choices not far from the hotel. The area is well lit for evening walking to the pubs and other entertainment. Good value and price for the big city stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Kyleigh P
Reviews.Content: We decided to prolong our holiday after our cruise by spending 2 days and a night in Sydney. Not knowing Sydney at all, after much searching online we found this hotel at $169 for the night including breakfast. Check in was officially 2pm, but when we arrived at just after 11am we were told our room was ready. We were quite tired, so it was a big relief to know we didnâ€™t have to wander the streets looking for a place to nap! The gentleman checking us in was efficient and so polite. The room was a fantastic size â€“ and the bathroom was great. There was a temperature and light control panel inside the front door that was incredibly easy to use. We switched the lights on from that panel and then when it was time for bed just turned off the lamps above the bed. The king size bed was very comfortable. We were on the second floor so we could hear the traffic just outside (we were facing a major road), which could be a problem if you are a really light sleeper like me, but I just popped in an earplug before falling asleep and it was completely fine. Breakfast was decent, typical cereals/fruit/muffins/pastries/hot food. Location is absolutely perfect! A minuteâ€™s walk to Darling Harbour and Chinatown, where we had dinner, Paddyâ€™s Market where we went for a wander, and the next day it was a great starting point to see the sights. We were able to leave our entire luggage at the hotel all day until we could pick it up on the way to the airport that night. When we returned, the concierge went up to the street to get us a taxi and we were on our way. If we go back to Sydney anytime soon we will definitely be staying here. It is a comfortable hotel that seems to be close to everything. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a Thursday & Friday. Very good service on check-in and checkout, nice room very clean and very quiet despite being directly opposite the Entertainment Centre and Chinatown. I was attending a trade show at the Conference Centre and the location was excellent for this and made it very easy to return to our room during the day. Also nice location for lots of touristy sites. I booked through the Accor/Novotel website & their prices were cheaper or the same as the late booking sites but included breakfast buffet (which was very nice) for both days which Wotif etc didn't. I notice another reviewer commented on the odd light switch situation. There is one switch near the door that turns on all of the lights in the room and the bathroom and no other obvious switches in either bed or bathroom so it seems you have to turn on every light during the night. There is however a full set of switches in the bedroom that control all of the lights including the bathroom. Ours were hidden away in behind the TV and you really had to search for them and then reach in behind the TV to use them. No real drama but a bit odd. Overall though a very nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to dislike”
Reviews.Author: jackko1234
Reviews.Content: when we got to the hotel in sydney we were quite tired after fly late from melbourne, we thought it could be a nightmere. but it wasnt we were served quickly at the front desk and were in our rooms by 20 mins on arrival. then when we entered are rooms the first thing i could see is the amazing skyline of sydney harbour! Fantastic! the rooms were very spacious with nice cossy beds.with good television selection with films , documentries etc....... the bathrooms were again spacious and there shower was top quillity. the only problem was the people i came with were not happy with the room as theres was facing other buildings. so do make sure you have a harbour side view. when we went it was new year and the views of the fireworks were outstanding and the party provided by the hotel was fantastic. would go again fantastic!! remember to get the view!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Darling Harbour- near the Chinese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Tas-wanderer
Reviews.Content: We have had an excellent stay at the Novotel Rockford. It is located at the end of Darling Harbour, simply walk out the main door, turn right, and you are then at the end of Darling Harbour area right next to the Chinese Gardens. Although there are major streets around the hotel there are no streets you have to cross to get to Darling Harbour, which is a real bonus. Also a real plus is that the monorail has a terminal just over the road in China town (see photos) so if you want to go to town and are foot sore it is so easy to catch the monorail (we bought a day pass which was good fun as it does a complete circuit and one comes along every 3-5 minutes...so very convenient!!). The monorail also goes to Darling Harbour (the loop only goes one way- from China town onto Sydney centre and then onto to Darling Harbour). The accommodation was very good and we were able, at night, to walk to Lyric Theatre at Star City to see Priscilla (musical)- which was such excellent entertainment. So to sum it all up: location was excellent, breakfast included (which was most acceptable- served in the restaurant on the ground floor at Ceezans), room was very clean and bed was good.(plus there was an extra blanket for those cold nights). There is also free internet for house guests- just need to get passwords from reception...great way to keep in contact with those at home. We ate at Darling Harbour one night at Ice Cube which is a seafood restaurant...the staff were most attentive, food came at a good pace, the meal and the wine was delightful and the view was a million dollars- we had such a lovely day! For those who are light sleepers may be good to pack some ear plugs as there are busy streets around the hotel and the traffic noises may be a problem..we were not worried by the noise but we were told the traffic was light due to school holidays.
